original: skyon gzhan yang 'di la yod de /

analyzed: rigs pa la sogs pa'i bdag la yang skyon 'di ste /

translated: The difference with the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas is that they assert it to be insentient.

analyzed: rtag pa ni rtag tu tshul gcig pa'o //

analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /

analyzed: 'dir bdag gzhan gyis 'dod pa ni ;

analyzed: sems pa'i sbyor bas sems pa can //

analyzed: rang nyid kyi ni ma yin no //

analyzed: zhes so // de bas ci yang mi byed pa kho na'o ;

original: / gal te rnam shes dang 'bad pa'i 'brel pas byed pa por 'dod na rnam shes dang 'bad pa la sogs pa rkyen gzhan dang 'brel kyang rtag pa yin pas 'gyur ba med pa la bya ba ga la yod /

original: sngar bzhin byed pa'i dus su yang bya ba gang yin pa la des phan pa ci byas /
analyzed: sngar bzhin byed pa'i dus su yang bya ba gang yin pa la des phan pa ci byas /
translated: What benefit does it derive from activity, even at the time when it is active, as it was before?

original: bdag @229b de'i byed pa 'di zhes 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan med do //
analyzed: bdag @229b de'i byed pa 'di zhes 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan med do //
translated: There is no reason to connect it with the activity of this or that.

original: des na rang dbang can med do //
analyzed: des na rang dbang can med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not autonomous.

original: bsdus shing bshad de bshad pa'i rigs pas thams cad gzhan dbang ste /
analyzed: bsdus shing bshad de bshad pa'i rigs pas thams cad gzhan dbang ste /
translated: Since all things are included in the aggregates, and since the aggregates are dependent on causes, all things are dependent on causes.

original: rgyu gang las byung ba rgyu de yang rang gi rgyu la ltos pa can yin pas /
analyzed: rgyu gang las byung ba rgyu de yang rang gi rgyu la ltos pa can yin pas /

original: thog ma med pa nas chos thams cad byed pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas chos thams cad byed pa med pa'o ;

original: / de ltar mya ngan las 'da' ba bzhin byed pa dang bral ba chos thams cad yin pa la blo ldan gar khro /
analyzed: / de ltar mya ngan las 'da' ba bzhin byed pa dang bral ba chos thams cad yin pa la blo ldan gar khro /

original: 'o na de ltar rang dbang can med pas gang gis gang 'gog ce na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar rang dbang can med pas gang gis gang 'gog ce na /

original: rigs pa mnyam pa'i phyir bzlog pa 'ang rigs pa min zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa mnyam pa'i phyir bzlog pa 'ang rigs pa min zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is illogical to stop them because they are equal in logic,

analyzed: lan ni bzlog par rigs te gang gi phyir bzlog pa de rten nas sdug bsngal rgyun chad par 'dod /
translated: the answer is that it is logical to stop them, because when they are stopped, we maintain that the continuum of suffering is severed.

original: de bas na zhe sdang la sogs pa bzlog par rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhe sdang la sogs pa bzlog par rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is logical to stop hatred and so on.

original: de bas dgra 'am mdza' ba 'am gnod pa byed pa mthong na 'di 'dra'i rkyen ni gnod pa'i tshul can 'di la yod par nges nas bde bar 'dod de /
analyzed: de bas dgra 'am mdza' ba 'am gnod pa byed pa mthong na 'di 'dra'i rkyen ni gnod pa'i tshul can 'di la yod par nges nas bde bar 'dod de /

original: yid mi bde ba mi byed do ;
analyzed: yid mi bde ba mi byed do ;

original: / gal te rgyu med par rang dga' tsam gyis skye bo rnams kyi don grub na /
analyzed: / gal te rgyu med par rang dga' tsam gyis skye bo rnams kyi don grub na /
translated: If people could accomplish their goals by themselves, without any cause,

analyzed: de'i tshe sdug bsngal su la mi 'byung ste /
translated: then who would not be happy?

original: gang gi phyir bdag gi sdug bsngal sus kyang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag gi sdug bsngal sus kyang mi 'dod do //
translated: For no one desires his own suffering.üîΩThe patience of accepting sufferingüîΩThe patience of accepting suffering is explained.

original: gzhan gyi gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa bshad de /
translated: The patience of not retaliating

analyzed: ma dpyad par byed pa 'di ni bag med pa'o ;
translated: The patience of not retaliating is explained.üîΩThe patience of bearing harmüîΩThe patience of bearing harm is explained.üîΩThe patience of enduring injury

translated: The patience of enduring injury is explained.üîΩThe patience of not retaliatingüîΩThe patience of not retaliating is explained.

analyzed: 'gyeg  pa dang / ri'i g-yang la sogs par ma tshang ba dang / mi'i nad du 'gro'am / chur 'jug pa'am /
translated: The patience of bearing harmüîΩThe patience of bearing harm is explained.

analyzed: dug dang mi 'phrod pa za ba 'am / bza' btung ha cang mang bas rmongs pa 'ga' zhig rang gi lus nyams par byed /
translated: The patience of enduring injuryüîΩThe patience of enduring injury is explained.üîΩThe patience of not retaliatingüîΩThe patience of not retaliating is explained.

analyzed: gzhan gsod pa la sogs pa bsod nams ma yin pa spyod pas kyang ngo //
translated: The patience of bearing harmüîΩThe patience of bearing harm is explained.

analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar bshad pa'i rigs pas nyon mongs pa'i shugs kyis bdag nyid sdug pa 'ang gsod na /

analyzed: de dag snying rje'i snod yin par bshad de /

original: nyon mongs pas myos par byas pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas myos par byas pa /
translated: Those who are intoxicated by afflictions

analyzed: bshad pa'i rigs pas bdag gsod pa la 'jug pa rnams la @230a * //
translated: and engage in killing themselves by the reasoning explained above

analyzed: snying rje med pa skyon 'ba' zhig pa ma yin gyi zhe sdang ji ltar skye /

analyzed: snying rje'i gnas la de mi rigs so //

analyzed: bzod pa'i thabs bshad de /

original: de'i tshe de dag la bdag gis zhe sdang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag la bdag gis zhe sdang mi rigs te /

analyzed: gal te skyon de rang bzhin ma yin glo bur ba ste /

analyzed: sems can rnams ni rang bzhin gyis nges pa yin na /
translated: If sentient beings are by nature determined,

original: de lta na de dag la khro ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: de lta na de dag la khro ba mi rigs te /

analyzed: dper na dud pa ma rungs pa dang ldan pa'i nam mkha' bzhin no //

analyzed: ma rungs pa ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin ma yin te /

analyzed: dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'on kyang du ba'i skyon yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang du ba'i skyon yin te /

analyzed: du ba ltar skyon rnams la khro bar mi rigs shing sems can la ma yin te /

analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su dag pas so //

analyzed: gzhan yang gang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gtso cher gyur pa gal te /
translated: Moreover, if you are angry with the principal cause of your suffering,

analyzed: de nas de 'phen pa po la khro na de'i tshe de 'ang zhe sdang gis 'phen pa yin pas bdag zhe sdang nyid la zhe sdang bar rigs so //

analyzed: las 'bras mi slu bar bsgoms nas 'di brjod par bshad de /

analyzed: de bas bdag la gzhan la gnod pa byas pa'i rgyu mthun 'di 'byung bar rigs pa kho na'o //

original: rigs pa gzhan bshad de /
analyzed: rigs pa gzhan bshad de /

original: gal te rgyu nye bar sdud pa po la khro na de'i tshe rang la yang rigs te ;
analyzed: gal te rgyu nye bar sdud pa po la khro na de'i tshe rang la yang rigs te ;
translated: If I am angry with the one who brings them together as a cause, then I should be angry with myself,

analyzed: gang gi phyir des mtshon cha dang / bdag gi lus phyung bas gang la khro /

analyzed: gnyis ka la skyon mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: rang dang gzhan la skyon mnyam par bshad nas /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la skyon mnyam par bshad nas /

original: rang kho na'i skyon bshad de /
analyzed: rang kho na'i skyon bshad de /

original: shu ba ni mi'i gzugs 'dra ba brdeg pa la sogs pa mi bzod pa bdag gis gzung ba yul lnga la sred pa spong bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: shu ba ni mi'i gzugs 'dra ba brdeg pa la sogs pa mi bzod pa bdag gis gzung ba yul lnga la sred pa spong bar gyur pa ste /

original: dbang po lnga dang ldan pa'i lus de dag gis de la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang ldan pa'i lus de dag gis de la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who have a body with the five senses enjoy it.

original: de la gnod pa byung bas su la khro //
analyzed: de la gnod pa byung bas su la khro //
translated: With whom should I be angry when harm arises to it?

original: lus ma bzung na gnod pa med //
analyzed: lus ma bzung na gnod pa med //
translated: If you do not grasp at the body, there is no harm.

original: bzung ba ni bdag gis te bdag kho na skyon can no //
analyzed: bzung ba ni bdag gis te bdag kho na skyon can no //
translated: But you do grasp at it, and so you alone are at fault.

original: gzhan yang bdag @230b byis pa sdug bsngal mi 'dod sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni 'dod /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag @230b byis pa sdug bsngal mi 'dod sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni 'dod /
translated: Moreover, you childish beings do not want suffering, but you do want the causes of suffering.

original: rgyu yod pas 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu yod pas 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung ste /
translated: Since the causes exist, the effects will certainly arise.

original: de la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And you enjoy them!

original: de la gnod pa 'byung bas su la khro //
analyzed: de la gnod pa 'byung bas su la khro //
translated: So, when harm arises, whom should you be angry with?

original: lus ma bzung na gnod pa med bzung ba ni bdag gis te /
analyzed: lus ma bzung na gnod pa med bzung ba ni bdag gis te /
translated: If you do not grasp at the body, there is no harm. But you do grasp at it, and so you alone are at fault.

original: 'bras bu mi 'dod na rgyu yang spang dgos /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi 'dod na rgyu yang spang dgos /
translated: If you do not want the effects, you must abandon the causes.

original: de las zlog pa byed pas byis pa bzhin /
analyzed: de las zlog pa byed pas byis pa bzhin /
translated: But you do the opposite, like a childish being.

original: de bas rang gi nyes pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yin pa la gzhan la khro bas ci /üîΩral gri ni gri la sogs pa mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: de bas rang gi nyes pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yin pa la gzhan la khro bas ci / ral gri ni gri la sogs pa mtshon pa ste /
translated: So, when suffering arises from your own faults, what point is there in being angry with others?

original: de dag ral gri lo ma yin pa de lta bu'i nags dang / bya ni bya rgod la sogs pa bdag gi las las byung ba ltar /üîΩgzhan gyi mtshon cha la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de dag ral gri lo ma yin pa de lta bu'i nags dang / bya ni bya rgod la sogs pa bdag gi las las byung ba ltar /üîΩgzhan gyi mtshon cha la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: The sword-leafed forest and the birds are like the weapons and so forth that arise from your own karma.

original: de bas nga'i las kyis bskul ba bdag gis gnod pa sngar byas pas bdag la gnod pa byed pa 'byung /
analyzed: de bas nga'i las kyis bskul ba bdag gis gnod pa sngar byas pas bdag la gnod pa byed pa 'byung /
translated: Therefore, since I have harmed them in the past, it is only right that they should harm me in return.

original: de bas de dag dmyal bar 'gro bas /
analyzed: de bas de dag dmyal bar 'gro bas /
translated: And so they will go to hell.üîΩHave I not destroyed them already?

original: bdag kho nas de dag ma brlag gam 'am gyi sgras rang sems 'bod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag kho nas de dag ma brlag gam 'am gyi sgras rang sems 'bod pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the last line calls on the mind to take up this attitude.

original: phan pa byed pa kho na la dga'i byed /üîΩces tshigs bcad gnyis kyis bshad de /
analyzed: phan pa byed pa kho na la dga'i byed / ces tshigs bcad gnyis kyis bshad de /
translated: It is only those who help us that we should love.

original: gnod byed 'di dag la brten nas bzod pa bsgoms pas skye ba snga ma la bdag gis byas pa'i sdig pa mang po cig zad /
analyzed: gnod byed 'di dag la brten nas bzod pa bsgoms pas skye ba snga ma la bdag gis byas pa'i sdig pa mang po cig zad /
translated: These two verses explain that it is on the basis of these harmful people that we cultivate patience, and so it is they who enable us to exhaust the many sins we have committed in the past.

original: bdag la brten nas bdag la gnod pa byas pas /
analyzed: bdag la brten nas bdag la gnod pa byas pas /
translated: And it is on account of us that they harm us.üîΩAnd so it is we who are the ones who harm them.

original: de dag sdug bsngal shin tu mi bzad pa'i dmyal bar 'gro de bas bdag kho na de dag gi gnod byed yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: de dag sdug bsngal shin tu mi bzad pa'i dmyal bar 'gro de bas bdag kho na de dag gi gnod byed yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gnod pa'i le lan las log pa bsam pa'i yon tan gal te bdag la 'byung na des dmyal bar mi 'gro bas phan byed de dag la yon tan ci byung ;
analyzed: gnod pa'i le lan las log pa bsam pa'i yon tan gal te bdag la 'byung na des dmyal bar mi 'gro bas phan byed de dag la yon tan ci byung ;
translated: If we are to receive the benefits of the practice of patience, we should not blame others for the harm they do to us. And if we are to receive the benefits of the practice of love, we should not blame others for the harm they do to us.

original: bdag gis bdag bsrung bar gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bdag bsrung bar gyur pa na'o //
translated: When I am my own protector.

original: gal te de dag la gnod pa'i le lan byas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de dag la gnod pa'i le lan byas par gyur na /
translated: If I retaliate against their harm,

original: des kyang de dag bsrung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang de dag bsrung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: that will not protect them.

original: bdag la gnod pa byas nas 'og tu 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa byas nas 'og tu 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of the harm I have done to them,

original: bdag gi spyod pa ni rdeg pa la yang brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag gi spyod pa ni rdeg pa la yang brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyams par 'gyur /
translated: my conduct will be ruined, such as when I say, ‚ÄúEven if I am struck, I will not strike in return.‚Äù

original: de bas thabs med pa'i phyir de dag nyams so zhes snying rje'o //
analyzed: de bas thabs med pa'i phyir de dag nyams so zhes snying rje'o //
translated: Therefore, because there is no other means, I will ruin them out of compassion.

original: chos la nges par rtogs par bzod pa bshad de /
analyzed: chos la nges par rtogs par bzod pa bshad de /
translated: The acceptance of the certainty of reality is explained.

original: yid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mind, etc.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis ma spyad pas gnod byed yin te lus dang yid las byung ba'o //üîΩ/ de @231a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis ma spyad pas gnod byed yin te lus dang yid las byung ba'o // / de @231a * //
translated: The mind is the agent of the two kinds of suffering, bodily and mental.

original: la yid ni sus kyang gar yang gzhom mi nus te lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la yid ni sus kyang gar yang gzhom mi nus te lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind cannot be conquered by anyone anywhere, because it is not material.

original: de bas de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal ni don dam par med do //
analyzed: de bas de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal ni don dam par med do //
translated: Therefore, the suffering that arises from it is ultimately nonexistent.

original: rtog pa las byung ba yid mi bde ba la sogs pa yod pas bshad de /
analyzed: rtog pa las byung ba yid mi bde ba la sogs pa yod pas bshad de /
translated: The mental dissatisfaction that arises from conceptualization is explained as existing.

original: lus la mngon par zhen pas na lus kyi sdug bsngal sems la gnod do //
analyzed: lus la mngon par zhen pas na lus kyi sdug bsngal sems la gnod do //
translated: Since one is attached to the body, the suffering of the body harms the mind.

original: brnyas pa la sogs pa lus la yang mi gnod de /
analyzed: brnyas pa la sogs pa lus la yang mi gnod de /
translated: Disparagement, etc., do not harm the body,

original: bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is inanimate.üîΩThese do not harm the body. So why be angry, O sentient being?

original: 'di dag ni lus la mi gnod pas kye sems can khyod ci ste khro brnyas pa la sogs pa thos nas bdag la 'jig rten ma dad par rtogs nas mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'di dag ni lus la mi gnod pas kye sems can khyod ci ste khro brnyas pa la sogs pa thos nas bdag la 'jig rten ma dad par rtogs nas mi 'dod ce na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúI do not want disparagement, etc., because I realize that the world will have no faith in me if it hears of it,‚Äù

original: smras pa / 'di ni dpyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ni dpyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: we reply: This is something to be investigated.

original: bdag la brnyas pa la sogs pa thos nas skye bo rnams ma dad pa gang yin pa des bdag za bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bdag la brnyas pa la sogs pa thos nas skye bo rnams ma dad pa gang yin pa des bdag za bar 'gyur ram /
translated: When one hears disparagement, etc., of oneself, will the lack of faith of others consume one?

original: skye ba 'di 'am pha rol du gang gis ma dad pa 'di bdag mi 'dod /
analyzed: skye ba 'di 'am pha rol du gang gis ma dad pa 'di bdag mi 'dod /
translated: Do you not want this lack of faith in this life or the next?

original: de bas 'dir mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas 'dir mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not be attached to this.

original: bdag gi rnyed pa'i bar chad byed pas ma dad pa mi 'dod na /
analyzed: bdag gi rnyed pa'i bar chad byed pas ma dad pa mi 'dod na /
translated: If one does not want lack of faith because it is an obstacle to one‚Äôs gain,

original: rnyed pa mi rtag pa 'di nyid du nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnyed pa mi rtag pa 'di nyid du nyams par 'gyur /
translated: This impermanent gain will be lost right here.

original: brnyas pa la sogs pa byed pa la khros pas byung ba'i sdig pa brtan par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brnyas pa la sogs pa byed pa la khros pas byung ba'i sdig pa brtan par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the sin that arises from anger at the one who insults, etc., will endure.

original: gnod byed la gnod pa byas pas rnyed pa na /
analyzed: gnod byed la gnod pa byas pas rnyed pa na /
translated: When one has gained by harming the one who harms,

original: log 'tsho yun ring po byung yang mchog ma yin te /
analyzed: log 'tsho yun ring po byung yang mchog ma yin te /
translated: it is not the best, even if it lasts a long time.

original: rnyed pa med pas de ring shi yang rung /
analyzed: rnyed pa med pas de ring shi yang rung /
translated: It is all right to die today, since there is no gain.

original: gang gi phyir yun ring po bsdad kyang 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal de nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yun ring po bsdad kyang 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal de nyid do //
translated: For, even if one stays a long time, the suffering of death is just that.

original: khyad med kho na gnyis kyis bshad de /
analyzed: khyad med kho na gnyis kyis bshad de /
translated: The two, Asvaghosa and Nagarjuna, explain it just the same:

original: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: As in a dream, etc.

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig rmi lam du myong ba lo brgyar bde ba la longs spyod nas sad kyang gzhan ni skad cig tu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig rmi lam du myong ba lo brgyar bde ba la longs spyod nas sad kyang gzhan ni skad cig tu'o //
translated: Just as someone experiences pleasure for a hundred years in a dream, and another for an instant,üîΩand the pleasure experienced in a dream is the same for both,

original: rmi lam du dmigs pa'i bde ba myong ba gnyi ga gnyid sad na myong ba'i bde ba de 'ong nyams /
analyzed: rmi lam du dmigs pa'i bde ba myong ba gnyi ga gnyid sad na myong ba'i bde ba de 'ong nyams /
translated: when they wake up, the pleasure experienced is gone for both.

original: de rjes su mi 'brang 'on kyang dran pa tsam lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de rjes su mi 'brang 'on kyang dran pa tsam lhag ma'o //
translated: It does not follow after, but only memory remains.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su dpe de nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su dpe de nyid yin te /
translated: This is the example at the time of death.

original: yun ring por gson pa dang ; yun thung bar gson pa gnyis kyi'o //
analyzed: yun ring por gson pa dang ; yun thung bar gson pa gnyis kyi'o //
translated: The second is for those who live a long time and those who live a short time.

original: yun rings gson pa dang yun thung bar gson pa gnyi ga yang phyis rjes su mi 'brang ste 'on kyang dran pa tsam /
analyzed: yun rings gson pa dang yun thung bar gson pa gnyi ga yang phyis rjes su mi 'brang ste 'on kyang dran pa tsam /
translated: Both those who live a long time and those who live a short time are not followed by a subsequent life.

original: thams cad rmi lam myong ba ltar //
analyzed: thams cad rmi lam myong ba ltar //
translated: All is like an experience in a dream.

original: song bslar ni mthong mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: song bslar ni mthong mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having gone, one does not see again.

original: de bas log @231b 'tshol dgos pa med do //
analyzed: de bas log @231b 'tshol dgos pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no need for wrong livelihood.

original: de bas na rnyed pa'i phyir dang bde ba'i phyir mi bzod pa mi rigs par bshad de /
analyzed: de bas na rnyed pa'i phyir dang bde ba'i phyir mi bzod pa mi rigs par bshad de /
translated: Therefore, it is explained that it is not right to be impatient for the sake of gain and pleasure.

original: rnyed pa mang po thob nas bde ba yun rings myong nas kyang 'chi ba'i dus su rgyags med pas lag pa stong pa dang / 'dod yon dang mi ldan pas sgren mo kho na chom rkun pas phrogs pa bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnyed pa mang po thob nas bde ba yun rings myong nas kyang 'chi ba'i dus su rgyags med pas lag pa stong pa dang / 'dod yon dang mi ldan pas sgren mo kho na chom rkun pas phrogs pa bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having obtained much gain and having experienced pleasure for a long time, at the time of death, one is powerless, with empty hands, naked, without sensual pleasures, like a thief robbed by robbers, one goes to the next world.

original: gal te rnyed pas yun rings gson cing sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pas sdig pa zad cing /
analyzed: gal te rnyed pas yun rings gson cing sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pas sdig pa zad cing /
translated: If you live a long time through gain, and if you eliminate evil through confessing it,

original: sdom pa bsrung bas bsod nams kyang byed ce na /
analyzed: sdom pa bsrung bas bsod nams kyang byed ce na /
translated: and if you also make merit through keeping vows,

original: 'o na rnyed pa'i ched du de la gnod pa rnams la zhe sdang byas te /
analyzed: 'o na rnyed pa'i ched du de la gnod pa rnams la zhe sdang byas te /
translated: then why, for the sake of gain, be angry with those who harm you?

original: bsod nams zad pa dang sdig pa mi 'byung ngam /
analyzed: bsod nams zad pa dang sdig pa mi 'byung ngam /
translated: Wouldn‚Äôt that destroy your merit and create evil?

original: de bas gang tshogs bsags pa'i phyir gson pa /
analyzed: de bas gang tshogs bsags pa'i phyir gson pa /
translated: Therefore, if you live in order to accumulate merit,

original: gal te legs spyad de nyid nyams na mi dge ba byed pa'i gson pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te legs spyad de nyid nyams na mi dge ba byed pa'i gson pas ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the point of living as one who does evil, even if you do live a long time?

original: grags pa ma yin pa sgrog mkhan la gang khyod khros pa des nyams par byed pa ste /
analyzed: grags pa ma yin pa sgrog mkhan la gang khyod khros pa des nyams par byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBut I am ruined by the anger of those who proclaim my disrepute!‚Äù

original: yon tan sbed pa dang / skyon brjod pas so ;
analyzed: yon tan sbed pa dang / skyon brjod pas so ;
translated: They hide your good qualities and proclaim your faults.

original: / yang na sems can ni 'jig rten pa rnams nyams par byed de /üîΩbdag gi grags pa ma yin pa bsgrags pas bdag lam dad par byed pas /
analyzed: / yang na sems can ni 'jig rten pa rnams nyams par byed de / bdag gi grags pa ma yin pa bsgrags pas bdag lam dad par byed pas /
translated: Or, you are ruined by worldly people,üîΩbecause they proclaim your disrepute and cause others to lose faith in you.

original: grags pa ma yin pa sgrogs pa la khro zhe na /
analyzed: grags pa ma yin pa sgrogs pa la khro zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúI am angry with those who proclaim my disrepute!‚Äù

original: smras pa / de'i tshe gang gzhan rnams kyi grags pa ma yin pa brjod /
analyzed: smras pa / de'i tshe gang gzhan rnams kyi grags pa ma yin pa brjod /
translated: Objection: At that time, why are you not angry at those who speak unpleasantly about others?

original: de la yang khyod ci ste mi khro /
analyzed: de la yang khyod ci ste mi khro /
translated: Why are you not angry at those who speak unpleasantly about others?

original: des kyang sems can rnams nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kyang sems can rnams nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they also cause sentient beings to decline.

original: de bas na bdag med kyang de sgro btags nas gzhan la mi bzod pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na bdag med kyang de sgro btags nas gzhan la mi bzod pa mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, even though they do not exist, it is unreasonable to be intolerant of others after imputing them.

original: gzhan yang sems can gzhan la rag las pa'i ma dad pa gzhan gyis byas pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can gzhan la rag las pa'i ma dad pa gzhan gyis byas pa de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, you should be tolerant of those who speak unpleasantly about you, because their lack of faith is dependent on others, and they are made to do it by others.

original: ma dad pa rnams las te /
analyzed: ma dad pa rnams las te /
translated: Therefore, it is due to those who lack faith.

original: gzhan la thos nas mi snyan pa sgrogs pa rnams la khyod bzod ce na /
analyzed: gzhan la thos nas mi snyan pa sgrogs pa rnams la khyod bzod ce na /
translated: You should be tolerant of those who speak unpleasantly about others after hearing it from others.

original: de'i tshe nyon mongs pa 'byung ba nyid gzhan yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyon mongs pa 'byung ba nyid gzhan yin te /
translated: At that time, the occurrence of afflictions is due to others.

original: de la rag las pa la yang khyod kyis bzod pa bya bar 'os /
analyzed: de la rag las pa la yang khyod kyis bzod pa bya bar 'os /
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate for you to be tolerant of those who are dependent on others.

original: rigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reasoning is the same.

original: des rang sems la go bar bya'o //
analyzed: des rang sems la go bar bya'o //
translated: You should understand your own mind.

original: dad pas kyang sdang sems mi bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dad pas kyang sdang sems mi bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained that you should not be angry even with those who lack faith.

original: sku gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIf you see a statue of the Tathagata. . . . ‚Äù

original: 'joms par byed pa dang / sun 'byin pa rnams la zhe sdang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'joms par byed pa dang / sun 'byin pa rnams la zhe sdang mi rigs te /
translated: It is not right to be angry with those who destroy or revile,

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang rgyal dang / nyan thos la gnod pa mi srid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang rgyal dang / nyan thos la gnod pa mi srid de /
translated: because it is impossible for Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Sravakas to be harmed.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa'i @232a * //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa'i @232a * //
translated: This is because they do not grasp at a self.

original: phyir ro ; / dgag par nus na snying rje'i sems kyis dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir ro ; / dgag par nus na snying rje'i sems kyis dgag par bya'o //
translated: If you are able to stop it, you should stop it with a compassionate attitude.

original: bla ma dang rang gi gnyen dang sogs pa'i sgras rus gcig pa 'am nye du la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bla ma dang rang gi gnyen dang sogs pa'i sgras rus gcig pa 'am nye du la sogs pa ste /
translated: Gurus, relatives, and so forth‚Äîthe word ‚Äúand so forth‚Äù includes those of the same ancestry, relatives, and so forth‚Äî

original: de dag la gnod pa rnams la sngar bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag la gnod pa rnams la sngar bzhin du /
translated: are harmed by others. As before,

original: nyes pa ji snyed thams cad dang // sdig pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: nyes pa ji snyed thams cad dang // sdig pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever faults there are, and whatever various sins there are,

original: de kun rkyen gyi stobs las byung //
analyzed: de kun rkyen gyi stobs las byung //
translated: all of them arise through the power of conditions.

original: rang dbang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang dbang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not independent.‚Äù

original: zhes so // gzhan yang sems can gyis byas pa ni lag pa dang rkang pas gang byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // gzhan yang sems can gyis byas pa ni lag pa dang rkang pas gang byas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the actions of sentient beings are those done with hands and feet.

original: sems can ma yin pas byas pa ni dbyug pa dang mtshon dang nad la sogs pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ma yin pas byas pa ni dbyug pa dang mtshon dang nad la sogs pas byas pa'o //
translated: The second is not a sentient being, such as a stick, a weapon, or a disease.

original: gnod pa ni sems can kho na la 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnod pa ni sems can kho na la 'byung ste /
translated: The harm is only to a sentient being.

original: de bas gnod pa'i rgyu gnyis yin pas /
analyzed: de bas gnod pa'i rgyu gnyis yin pas /
translated: Therefore, the two are the causes of harm.

original: kye yid sems can kho na la gnod pa mthong nas bzod par mdzod /
analyzed: kye yid sems can kho na la gnod pa mthong nas bzod par mdzod /
translated: O mind, seeing only sentient beings as the cause of harm, be patient!

original: gang zhig gang skye ba'i gnas yin pa de nyid las bskyed de /
analyzed: gang zhig gang skye ba'i gnas yin pa de nyid las bskyed de /
translated: Whatever is born from a place, it is produced from that very place.

original: dper na 'dam las padma bzhin //
analyzed: dper na 'dam las padma bzhin //
translated: For example, a lotus is born from mud.

original: rnam shes dang bcas pa'i lus kyang skye ba'i gnas zhes rang bzhin gyis brtags so //
analyzed: rnam shes dang bcas pa'i lus kyang skye ba'i gnas zhes rang bzhin gyis brtags so //
translated: The body with consciousness is also designated as the place of birth by nature.

original: rang bzhin la klan kas mi phan te bzod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin la klan kas mi phan te bzod par bya'o //
translated: Since it is useless to find fault with nature, one should be patient.

original: gnyis ka'i skyon bshad de /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i skyon bshad de /
translated: The faults of both are explained.

original: gti mug gis bdag dang bdag gi bar bzung ste /
analyzed: gti mug gis bdag dang bdag gi bar bzung ste /
translated: Through delusion, one grasps at self and what belongs to the self.

original: 'ga' zhig gis bsdigs pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa byas pas nyes pa can du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis bsdigs pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa byas pas nyes pa can du 'gyur /
translated: If someone threatens, beats, etc., one becomes guilty.

original: de la rmongs pas gzhan la yang khros te /
analyzed: de la rmongs pas gzhan la yang khros te /
translated: Through delusion about that, one also becomes angry at others.

original: slar brdeg pa la sogs pa byas pas so //
analyzed: slar brdeg pa la sogs pa byas pas so //
translated: By striking back, etc., one becomes guilty.

original: de dag gi nang nyes pa med par gang brjod /
analyzed: de dag gi nang nyes pa med par gang brjod /
translated: What is it that you say is not a fault?

original: gang nyes pa can du brjod gnyi ga la skyon mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: gang nyes pa can du brjod gnyi ga la skyon mtshungs pas so //
translated: What is it that you say is a fault? Both are equally faulty.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan dag gis khyod la gnod pa bskyal ba /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan dag gis khyod la gnod pa bskyal ba /
translated: Why is it that others inflict harm on you?

original: kye yid 'bras bu 'di lta bur gyur pa'i las sngar khyod kyis ci ste byas /
analyzed: kye yid 'bras bu 'di lta bur gyur pa'i las sngar khyod kyis ci ste byas /
translated: Oh mind, why did you previously create such an action that has resulted in this?

original: de lta yin kyang phan pa 'tshal zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin kyang phan pa 'tshal zhe na /
translated: If you think that you still need to benefit yourself,

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu thams cad las kyis bskyed pa yin pas /
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu thams cad las kyis bskyed pa yin pas /
translated: I say: Since all causes of suffering are produced by karma,

original: de bzlog par bdag gis ga la nus /
analyzed: de bzlog par bdag gis ga la nus /
translated: how can I stop it?

original: gang gi phyir tshogs pa mthar phyin pas 'bras bu nyid bskyed pa nyid do //üîΩsems can 'di dag nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis las ngan byed pa las bzlog par mi nus par shes na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshogs pa mthar phyin pas 'bras bu nyid bskyed pa nyid do // sems can 'di dag nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis las ngan byed pa las bzlog par mi nus par shes na /
translated: Since the collection has been completed, the result itself is produced.üîΩIf you know that these sentient beings are unable to stop the bad karma they create due to the power of the afflictions,

original: dge ba la de ltar 'bad par bya ba'i gang gi nus pa'i khyad par thob nas /
analyzed: dge ba la de ltar 'bad par bya ba'i gang gi nus pa'i khyad par thob nas /
translated: then you should strive in virtue.

original: lam dam pa la 'jug par byed pa rnams phan tshun du byams sems can dang @232b ldan par 'gyur ba rnams so //
analyzed: lam dam pa la 'jug par byed pa rnams phan tshun du byams sems can dang @232b ldan par 'gyur ba rnams so //
translated: Those who enter the holy path will be endowed with mutual loving-kindness.

original: da byed pa'i cho ga bshad de /
analyzed: da byed pa'i cho ga bshad de /
translated: Now the rite of expiation is explained.

original: khang pa gcig tshig pa na khang pa gzhan du me song zhing /
analyzed: khang pa gcig tshig pa na khang pa gzhan du me song zhing /
translated: When one house is on fire, the fire spreads to another house,

original: rtsva sogs gang la mched pa de phyung ste dor ba yin thams cad mi nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsva sogs gang la mched pa de phyung ste dor ba yin thams cad mi nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and whatever grass, etc., it spreads to, that is removed and discarded, in order that everything else may not be destroyed.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rigs pas sems ni dngos po gang la chags pas /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rigs pas sems ni dngos po gang la chags pas /
translated: By the reasoning explained in that way, the mind is attached to some thing,

original: zhe sdang gi mes tshig pas skad cig de dor bar bya zhes pa spangs nas so //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi mes tshig pas skad cig de dor bar bya zhes pa spangs nas so //
translated: and because it is burned by the fire of hatred, it is said that it should be discarded in that moment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsod nams tshig tu dogs pas so //
analyzed: bsod nams tshig tu dogs pas so //
translated: Because merit is feared to be burned.

original: gsod par 'os pa gang yin pa gal te de lag pa tsam bcad nas btang na de'i tshe rnyed pa chen po rnyed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gsod par 'os pa gang yin pa gal te de lag pa tsam bcad nas btang na de'i tshe rnyed pa chen po rnyed pa ma yin nam /
translated: If one who deserves to be killed is released by just having a hand cut off, then isn't that a great gain?

original: de ltar mi lus kyi sdug bsngal 'ching ba dang smod pa la sogs pa myong nas dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal las grol na ci ma rung zhes rtogs nas bzod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi lus kyi sdug bsngal 'ching ba dang smod pa la sogs pa myong nas dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal las grol na ci ma rung zhes rtogs nas bzod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having experienced the suffering of the human condition, such as being bound and reviled, one should cultivate patience, thinking, ‚ÄúHow wonderful it would be if others were freed from the suffering of the hells!‚Äù

original: gal te rdung ba dang rdeg pa la sogs pa tsam lta bzod par mi nus na /
analyzed: gal te rdung ba dang rdeg pa la sogs pa tsam lta bzod par mi nus na /
translated: If one cannot bear the mere beating and striking,

original: dmyal ba'i rgyu khro ba ci ste bzlog par mi byed /
analyzed: dmyal ba'i rgyu khro ba ci ste bzlog par mi byed /
translated: why not stop the anger that is the cause of the hells?

original: khros pa'i nyes pas don med par btsan thabs su yang sos la sogs par lan stong phrag tu gcod pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pas bdag sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khros pa'i nyes pas don med par btsan thabs su yang sos la sogs par lan stong phrag tu gcod pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pas bdag sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the fault of anger, one is senselessly and violently tormented in the Reviving Hell and so on for thousands of times, being cut and burned.

original: sdug bsngal myong zhing bdag gis rang gi don nam gzhan gyi don phan pa bde ba ma byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong zhing bdag gis rang gi don nam gzhan gyi don phan pa bde ba ma byas pa nyid do //
translated: One experiences suffering and does not benefit oneself or others.

original: lag pa gcod pa la sogs pa 'dis dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal dang mi 'dra mod /
analyzed: lag pa gcod pa la sogs pa 'dis dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal dang mi 'dra mod /
translated: The cutting off of the hand and so on is not like the suffering of the hells.

original: 'on kyang don chen ni 'gro ba kun gyi don byed pa sangs rgyas nyid kyis byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang don chen ni 'gro ba kun gyi don byed pa sangs rgyas nyid kyis byed par 'gyur /
translated: Nevertheless, one does accomplish a great purpose, for one becomes a Buddha who acts for the welfare of all beings.

original: de bas 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa'i sdug bsngal la dga' ba kho na byed par rigs so //
analyzed: de bas 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa'i sdug bsngal la dga' ba kho na byed par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is right to delight only in the suffering that removes the suffering of the world.

original: gzhan gyi yon tan thos nas phrag dog dri ma 'khru par bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yon tan thos nas phrag dog dri ma 'khru par bshad de /
translated: When you hear of the good qualities of others, wash away the stain of envy.

original: yon tan lhag pha can la bstod nas gal te 'ga' zhig gi bde ba thob pa /
analyzed: yon tan lhag pha can la bstod nas gal te 'ga' zhig gi bde ba thob pa /
translated: If you praise someone who has superior good qualities and he obtains happiness,

original: de'i tshe yid khyod kyis kyang de la bstod nas ci ste bde ba myong bar mi byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe yid khyod kyis kyang de la bstod nas ci ste bde ba myong bar mi byed /
translated: then why, mind, do you not praise others and experience happiness?

original: don med par phrag dog gi me 'bar bas ci ste bdag 'tshig par byed /üîΩgang dang gang du dga' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: don med par phrag dog gi me 'bar bas ci ste bdag 'tshig par byed / gang dang gang du dga' bar 'gyur //
translated: Why do you burn yourself with the meaningless fire of envy?üîΩWhen you hear of the good qualities of others, do not think, How can I obtain them?üîΩBut rather think, How can I obtain them?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde ba la zhen pa dgag ce na ma yin te nyes pa dang bcas pa dgag pa yin gyi 'di ni nyes pa med pa bde pa'i rgyu brtan pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis ma bkag par gzhan gyi yon tan 'di la
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde ba la zhen pa dgag ce na ma yin te nyes pa dang bcas pa dgag pa yin gyi 'di ni nyes pa med pa bde pa'i rgyu brtan pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis ma bkag par gzhan gyi yon tan 'di la
translated: If you think, I will not obtain them, you will not obtain them.

original: phrag dog mi byed ces nas gzhan dag kyang sdud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrag dog mi byed ces nas gzhan dag kyang sdud par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think, I will obtain them, you will obtain them.

original: bstod pa byed mkhan @233a * //
analyzed: bstod pa byed mkhan @233a * //
translated: Those who praise youüîΩ

original: kho na'i bde ba de yin pas bdag gis bzod mi nus she na /
analyzed: kho na'i bde ba de yin pas bdag gis bzod mi nus she na /
translated: If you think, I cannot bear the happiness of those who praise me,

original: de'i tshe rang gi don du gla ba la gla rngan dang sogs pa'i sgras phan btags pa la phan lan gzhan gyi bde ba la sdang bas mi yong /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi don du gla ba la gla rngan dang sogs pa'i sgras phan btags pa la phan lan gzhan gyi bde ba la sdang bas mi yong /
translated: then you should not receive wages for your own sake, and so on. The phrase and so on indicates that you should not expect any reward for helping others.

original: gang gi phyir des de la bde bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir des de la bde bar 'byung ngo //
translated: Because that will bring them happiness.

original: de bas mthong ba ni skye ba 'di nyid kyi dang ma mthong ba ni pha rol gyi ste /
analyzed: de bas mthong ba ni skye ba 'di nyid kyi dang ma mthong ba ni pha rol gyi ste /
translated: Therefore, you will not see the happiness of this life, and you will not see the happiness of future lives.

original: mi bzod pa la gnyi ga med par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi bzod pa la gnyi ga med par 'gyur /
translated: But if you are impatient, you will have neither.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig khyed kyi yon tan brjod na de'i tshe gzhan gyi bde ba 'ang khyed 'dod /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig khyed kyi yon tan brjod na de'i tshe gzhan gyi bde ba 'ang khyed 'dod /
translated: If someone praises your good qualities, you want that person to be happy.

original: gal te gzhan gyi yon tan brjod na de'i tshe khyod kyis de la bstod nas /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi yon tan brjod na de'i tshe khyod kyis de la bstod nas /
translated: If someone praises the good qualities of others, you praise that person.

original: gang rang gi bde ba de 'ang mi 'dod pa /
analyzed: gang rang gi bde ba de 'ang mi 'dod pa /
translated: But you do not want the happiness of either of them.

original: gzhan yang kye yid khyod kyis ma rig pa la smod /
analyzed: gzhan yang kye yid khyod kyis ma rig pa la smod /
translated: Moreover, O mind, you despise ignorance,üîΩbut you are pleased by the praise of your own good qualities.

original: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad bde ba thams cad dang ldan par bdag gis bya'o zhes bya ba'i 'dod pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad bde ba thams cad dang ldan par bdag gis bya'o zhes bya ba'i 'dod pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: Since you have generated the spirit of enlightenment with the aspiration, ‚ÄúI will cause all sentient beings to have all happiness,‚Äù

analyzed: da ni dad pa'i gnas la sems dang bar byas la rang nyid kyis thob pa'i bde ba can sems can rnams la ci ste khro /

original: rnyed pa la sogs pa mi 'dod pa mi rigs par bshad de /
analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa mi 'dod pa mi rigs par bshad de /

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gsum la gnas pas mchod pa'i sangs rgyas nyid sems can rnams kyi khyod 'dod la bsnyen bkur ngan don tsam mthong nas ci'i phyir de la gdung bar byed ;
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gsum la gnas pas mchod pa'i sangs rgyas nyid sems can rnams kyi khyod 'dod la bsnyen bkur ngan don tsam mthong nas ci'i phyir de la gdung bar byed ;
translated: You want the buddhahood of the three realms‚Äîthe desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm‚Äîto be worshipped by sentient beings. Why do you get angry at them when you see them paying service and respect to someone else?üîΩThe explanation of the intended meaning of the scriptures

original: rnyed pa dgongs te bshad pa /
analyzed: rnyed pa dgongs te bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of the intended meaning of the aboveüîΩ

original: khyod kyis gso bar bya ba khyed rang gi bu la sogs pa gang gis gso bar byed /
analyzed: khyod kyis gso bar bya ba khyed rang gi bu la sogs pa gang gis gso bar byed /
translated: By whom are your own children and so forth, who are to be nurtured, nurtured?

original: de khyed kho na la ster bas khyed kyi nye du gso bar byed pa gang yin pa de thos nas /
analyzed: de khyed kho na la ster bas khyed kyi nye du gso bar byed pa gang yin pa de thos nas /
translated: They are given to you alone. Therefore, having heard that those who nurture your relatives are given to you,

original: dga' bar mi byed par khro ba ci /
analyzed: dga' bar mi byed par khro ba ci /
translated: Why be angry with those who do not delight in it?

original: byang chub kho na 'dod ce na /
analyzed: byang chub kho na 'dod ce na /
translated: If you want only enlightenment,

original: smras pa / sems can rnams kyi byang chub 'dod mkhan gang yin pa des de dag gi phun sum tshogs pa ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: smras pa / sems can rnams kyi byang chub 'dod mkhan gang yin pa des de dag gi phun sum tshogs pa ci ste mi 'dod /

analyzed: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la khro ba'i mi la byang chub kyi sems ga la yod /

original: de nyid kyi rnyed pa bdag gi ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rnyed pa bdag gi ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúI do not want his gain,‚Äù

original: smras pa / gal te khyod kyis mi 'dod pa'i gang zag gis de ma thob cing /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te khyod kyis mi 'dod pa'i gang zag gis de ma thob cing /
translated: then I say: If you do not want a person, he will not obtain it.

original: de'i yon bdag gi khyim kho nar gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i yon bdag gi khyim kho nar gnas par 'gyur /
translated: And he will remain in the house of his patron.

original: de bas de la byin pa dang ma byin pas khyed la ci /
analyzed: de bas de la byin pa dang ma byin pas khyed la ci /
translated: So what does it matter to you whether you give to him or not?üîΩSince he is in no way yours, it is pointless to be impatient.

original: rnam pa thams cad du khyed la de med pas mi bzod pa don med re zhig dpyod dang gang la skye bo rnams kyis mchod pa des rang gi bsod nams 'bras bu ster ba la phyogs @233b pa de 'dor ba yin nam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du khyed la de med pas mi bzod pa don med re zhig dpyod dang gang la skye bo rnams kyis mchod pa des rang gi bsod nams 'bras bu ster ba la phyogs @233b pa de 'dor ba yin nam /
translated: Consider this: When people make offerings to someone, is it because they want to give the fruit of their merit to him?

original: yang na dad pa can yon bdag 'dor ram /
analyzed: yang na dad pa can yon bdag 'dor ram /
translated: Or do they want to give up their faithful patrons?

original: yang na dang ba'i rgyu rang gi yon tan 'dor /
analyzed: yang na dang ba'i rgyu rang gi yon tan 'dor /
translated: Or, do you not accept that the cause of faith is the relinquishing of your own good qualities?

original: rnyed kyang mi len nam smros shig / khyed ci la mi bzod /
analyzed: rnyed kyang mi len nam smros shig / khyed ci la mi bzod /
translated: What is it that you cannot bear?

original: bsod nams la sogs pa 'dor mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa 'dor mi nus pa nyid do //

original: khyod ni rang gi la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: khyod ni rang gi la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: You are not able to relinquish your own good qualities and so forth.

original: gzhan yang khyed la dri ;
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed la dri ;
translated: Moreover, we ask you this:

original: gal te khyod kyi dgra bo la mi 'dod pa byung na las ngan gyi dbang gis de la khyod dga' bas slar ci /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi dgra bo la mi 'dod pa byung na las ngan gyi dbang gis de la khyod dga' bas slar ci /
translated: If your enemy experiences something undesirable, then due to the power of bad karma, why would you be happy about that?

original: bdag gis smon pas mi 'dod pa de byung zhe na /
analyzed: bdag gis smon pas mi 'dod pa de byung zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúI do not want that undesirable event to occur,‚Äù

original: ma yin te de tsam gyis rang gi rgyu med na mi srid do //
analyzed: ma yin te de tsam gyis rang gi rgyu med na mi srid do //
translated: then that is not so, because without your own cause, it is impossible for that to occur.üîΩLet it occur!

original: srid du chug / gal te dgra bo las mi 'dod pa khyed kyi smon pas 'grub na /
analyzed: srid du chug / gal te dgra bo las mi 'dod pa khyed kyi smon pas 'grub na /
translated: If your enemy‚Äôs undesirable event is accomplished by your wish,

original: de'i sdug bsngal khyed la dgos pa ci /
analyzed: de'i sdug bsngal khyed la dgos pa ci /
translated: then what need do you have for that enemy‚Äôs suffering?

original: bde ba ni med do //
analyzed: bde ba ni med do //
translated: There is no happiness.

original: gal te gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la dga' ba don yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la dga' ba don yin na /
translated: If you are happy about the suffering of others,

original: 'di pas phung po gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di pas phung po gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: then what other purpose is there for this existence?

original: ngan song gi rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: ngan song gi rgyu yin pas so //
translated: It is the cause of the lower realms.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan phung ba'i sems lcags kyu 'jigs su rung ba /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan phung ba'i sems lcags kyu 'jigs su rung ba /
translated: Because the mind of others is a terrible hook for destroying oneself,

original: nyon mongs pa'i nya bas btab pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nya bas btab pa /
translated: cast by the fisherman of the afflictions,

original: gang las gshin rje'i pho nya rnams kyis bslangs te /
analyzed: gang las gshin rje'i pho nya rnams kyis bslangs te /
translated: from which the messengers of the Lord of Death pull one out

original: me 'bar ba'i bum pa chen por bcug ste 'tshed bar 'gyur /
analyzed: me 'bar ba'i bum pa chen por bcug ste 'tshed bar 'gyur /
translated: and throw one into a great blazing iron pot to be cooked.

original: de bas 'di mi legs so //
analyzed: de bas 'di mi legs so //
translated: Therefore, this is not good.

original: bstod pa la sogs pa la gnod pas bde ba gang yin pa de yang ma spyad pas zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bstod pa la sogs pa la gnod pas bde ba gang yin pa de yang ma spyad pas zhes bshad de /
translated: Since praise, etc. are harmful, one should not enjoy them.

original: skyes bu'i don ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The purpose of a person is of five kinds:

original: bsod nams dang / tshe ring ba dang / lus stobs dang / nad med pa dang lus kyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang / tshe ring ba dang / lus stobs dang / nad med pa dang lus kyi bde ba'o //
translated: merit, long life, physical strength, health, and physical pleasure.

original: de dag gi nang na bstod pa la sogs pa 'di gsum gar yang mi dgos so //
analyzed: de dag gi nang na bstod pa la sogs pa 'di gsum gar yang mi dgos so //
translated: Among them, these three‚Äîpraise, etc.‚Äîare not necessary for any of them.

analyzed: blo dang ldan pa bdag gi don rig pa'i rang don rnam pa lnga po 'di dag srid de /
translated: The wise one who knows his own purpose has these five kinds of his own purpose,

original: 'di dag gis ye shes sgrub pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'di dag gis ye shes sgrub pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because they accomplish wisdom.

original: /'o na yid la yang yod ce na /
analyzed: /'o na yid la yang yod ce na /

original: smras pa / yid kyi bde ba 'dod na chang dang cho long dang / smad 'tshong gi bud med bsten par 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / yid kyi bde ba 'dod na chang dang cho long dang / smad 'tshong gi bud med bsten par 'gyur /

original: de ni mi rigs te sdig pas so //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te sdig pas so //
translated: Reply: That is not right, because it is sinful.

original: de bas bstod pa la sogs pa la byis pa dga' bar byed pa yin gyi blang bya ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas bstod pa la sogs pa la byis pa dga' bar byed pa yin gyi blang bya ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, praise and so on are the delight of fools, but they are not something to be adopted.

original: byis pa rnams kho na khyod nyi ma yin khyod zla ba zhes bya ba'i ched du stod byed kyis nor shor bar byed /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kho na khyod nyi ma yin khyod zla ba zhes bya ba'i ched du stod byed kyis nor shor bar byed /
translated: Fools praise you, saying, ‚ÄúYou are the sun,‚Äù ‚ÄúYou are the moon,‚Äù and so on, but they cause you to lose your wealth.

original: brtags pa'i yon tan de dag gis bdag nga rgyal bskyed nas dgra bo phung pa'i grags pa'i don du g-yul du zhugs te bdag kyang gsod par byed /
analyzed: brtags pa'i yon tan de dag gis bdag nga rgyal bskyed nas dgra bo phung pa'i grags pa'i don du g-yul du zhugs te bdag kyang gsod par byed /
translated: Because of those qualities that are imagined, you generate pride and enter into battle for the sake of fame that destroys your enemies, and you will be killed.

original: don dam par bstod pa de dag bza' bar bya ba @234a * //
analyzed: don dam par bstod pa de dag bza' bar bya ba @234a * //
translated: In reality, those praises are something to be eaten,

original: yin mod / mi bden pa'i rnam rtog las byung ba /
analyzed: yin mod / mi bden pa'i rnam rtog las byung ba /
translated: but they arise from false imagination.

original: nga'i grags pa zhes brtags pa'i bde ba yang shin su'i yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: nga'i grags pa zhes brtags pa'i bde ba yang shin su'i yin par 'gyur /
translated: What pleasure is there in the imagined pleasure of my fame?

original: de bas byis pa'i rtse ba 'di dag dang mnyam par bshad de /
analyzed: de bas byis pa'i rtse ba 'di dag dang mnyam par bshad de /
translated: Therefore, explain that these are equal to the play of fools.

original: ji ltar byis pa bye ma la khang pa byas te /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa bye ma la khang pa byas te /
translated: Just as a child builds a house out of sand,

original: de la rtse zhing yi rangs 'ga' zhig gis de bshig pa na bdag gi khang pa bcom par bsams te /
analyzed: de la rtse zhing yi rangs 'ga' zhig gis de bshig pa na bdag gi khang pa bcom par bsams te /
