original: brang rdung zhing du /
analyzed: brang rdung zhing du /
translated: and cries out with his chest beaten,

original: sdug bsngal chen po can du 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po can du 'gyur /
translated: and becomes greatly distressed,

original: de bzhin du bstod pa la sogs pa nyams pa'i don med par sdug bsngal bar bdag la snang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bstod pa la sogs pa nyams pa'i don med par sdug bsngal bar bdag la snang /
translated: in the same way, it seems, I am distressed without reason at the loss of praise, etc.

original: 'di nyid du rnam dpyod ni tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bshad de /
analyzed: 'di nyid du rnam dpyod ni tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bshad de /
translated: This is analyzed in four verses.

original: yi ge rnams kyis bzhin sgra ni sems pa med pas des bdag la bstod ces mi srid de /
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyis bzhin sgra ni sems pa med pas des bdag la bstod ces mi srid de /
translated: Since sound is not conscious, like letters, it is impossible that it praise me.

original: gzhan bstod pa la sogs pa mngon par dang bas zhes bya ba rtog pa dga' ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gzhan bstod pa la sogs pa mngon par dang bas zhes bya ba rtog pa dga' ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: But the cause of the delight of the imagination is the clear manifestation of the praise of another.

original: 'brel pa med par bshad de /
analyzed: 'brel pa med par bshad de /
translated: This is explained as being irrelevant.

original: sems can gzhan nam bdag la yang rung ste /üîΩgzhan dga' bas bdag la ci /
analyzed: sems can gzhan nam bdag la yang rung ste / gzhan dga' bas bdag la ci /
translated: Whether it is another sentient being or myself,üîΩwhat is the relevance of my delight in the joy of another?

original: gang gi phyir dga' ba de de nyid kyi yin pas de'i cha shas chung ngu yang bdag la med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dga' ba de de nyid kyi yin pas de'i cha shas chung ngu yang bdag la med do //
translated: Since that joy is his, I have no part of it at all.

original: gal te de'i bde bas blo ldan nyid kyang bde na de'i tshe gzhan la dang pas bde ba thams cad la bdag gi bde ba de yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de'i bde bas blo ldan nyid kyang bde na de'i tshe gzhan la dang pas bde ba thams cad la bdag gi bde ba de yod par 'gyur /
translated: If the wise man is happy when others are happy, then he has all the happiness of all people.

original: gzhan la dad pa bskyed nas bde bar gyur pa rnams la ci'i phyir bdag bde bar mi byed /
analyzed: gzhan la dad pa bskyed nas bde bar gyur pa rnams la ci'i phyir bdag bde bar mi byed /
translated: Why would he not be happy when others are happy through his own efforts?

original: de bas rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no other reason.

original: bdag ni bstod do zhes brtags pas rang la dga' ba skyes te gzhan dga' bas dga' ba'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni bstod do zhes brtags pas rang la dga' ba skyes te gzhan dga' bas dga' ba'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: He is not happy when others are happy because he thinks, ‚ÄúI am being praised.‚Äù

original: der yang bdag la dga' bo zhes bya ba la de'i bdag dang / de las byung ba'i 'brel pa med par byis pa'i ro la 'ba' zhig pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: der yang bdag la dga' bo zhes bya ba la de'i bdag dang / de las byung ba'i 'brel pa med par byis pa'i ro la 'ba' zhig pa 'di yin no //
translated: In that case, he would be happy when others are happy because of his own happiness, but there is no connection between the two.

original: don dam par bstod pa la sogs pa 'di bdag gi bsrung ba dang / srid pa'i du: kha las skyo ba nyams par byed /
analyzed: don dam par bstod pa la sogs pa 'di bdag gi bsrung ba dang / srid pa'i du: kha las skyo ba nyams par byed /
translated: In reality, praise, etc. destroy his self-control and his disgust with the world.

original: yon tan gyi nga rgyal gyis gzhan gyi yon tan dag la ser sna byed pa de'i yon tan sbed pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: yon tan gyi nga rgyal gyis gzhan gyi yon tan dag la ser sna byed pa de'i yon tan sbed pa'i phyir ro//
translated: He is jealous of the good qualities of others because of pride in his own qualities, and he conceals the good qualities of others.

original: de dag gi phun sum tshogs pa la yang khro ba phrag dog byed do //üîΩde bas bdag gi bstod pa la sogs pa gzhom pa'i phyir gang nye bar gnas pa de dag ngan song du ltung ba las /
analyzed: de dag gi phun sum tshogs pa la yang khro ba phrag dog byed do // de bas bdag gi bstod pa la sogs pa gzhom pa'i phyir gang nye bar gnas pa de dag ngan song du ltung ba las /
translated: They are angry and jealous of the good qualities of others.üîΩTherefore, those who are present to destroy my praise, etc. are my friends, not my enemies, since they prevent me from falling into the lower realms.

original: bdag bsrung ba'i tshe ched du 'jug pas mdza' bo yin gyi gnod byed ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag bsrung ba'i tshe ched du 'jug pas mdza' bo yin gyi gnod byed ma yin no //
translated: When I am protecting myself, they are acting deliberately.

original: gzhan yang grol bar @234b 'dod pas rnyed pa la sogs pa'i 'ching ba lta bu zhen pa'i gnas yin pas mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang grol bar @234b 'dod pas rnyed pa la sogs pa'i 'ching ba lta bu zhen pa'i gnas yin pas mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is unreasonable to be attached to them, since they are a basis for attachment, like the fetter of gain, etc.

original: dgra bo gang zhig gis bdag bcings pa la grol bar byed pa de la bdag sdang bar ji ltar rigs /
analyzed: dgra bo gang zhig gis bdag bcings pa la grol bar byed pa de la bdag sdang bar ji ltar rigs /
translated: How can it be reasonable to be angry with those who liberate me from the bonds of an enemy?

original: rnyed pa la sogs pa la zhen pas srid pa'i sdug bsngal la ltung bar 'dod pa'i gang sgo 'phar du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus 'di dag go bzhin du de la zhe sdang rigs so //üîΩrnyed pa la sogs pas 'joms pas bsod nams la gegs byas nas /
analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa la zhen pas srid pa'i sdug bsngal la ltung bar 'dod pa'i gang sgo 'phar du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus 'di dag go bzhin du de la zhe sdang rigs so //üîΩrnyed pa la sogs pas 'joms pas bsod nams la gegs byas nas /
translated: It is reasonable to be angry with those who, through attachment to gain, etc., cause me to fall into the sufferings of cyclic existence, since they are the door to that.üîΩThey are the door, since they are the cause of my falling into cyclic existence.üîΩThey are the door, since they are the cause of my falling into cyclic existence.

original: de lta yin kyang de la khro ba mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta yin kyang de la khro ba mi 'dod de /
translated: Nevertheless, it is not right to be angry with him.

original: gang gi phyir bzod pa dang mnyam pa'i dka' thub med /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bzod pa dang mnyam pa'i dka' thub med /
translated: Because there is no austerity equal to patience,

original: dge ba thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since it is the cause of all virtue.

original: kye 'bad pa med par de ni nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: kye 'bad pa med par de ni nye bar gnas so //
translated: Oh, it is present without effort!

original: gal te bdag rang gi skyon ma rig pas bzod pa mi byed na de'i tshe bdag kho nas bsod nams 'di la gegs byas /
analyzed: gal te bdag rang gi skyon ma rig pas bzod pa mi byed na de'i tshe bdag kho nas bsod nams 'di la gegs byas /
translated: If I do not practice patience because of my own ignorance, then I alone am obstructing this merit.

original: bsod nams kyi rgyu rnyed pa 'joms pa po nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rgyu rnyed pa 'joms pa po nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: I am the one who is present to destroy the cause of merit that I have found.

original: rigs pa bshad de bzod pa zhes bya ba //
analyzed: rigs pa bshad de bzod pa zhes bya ba //
translated: I have explained the logic of patience.

original: gang zhig gnod pa med na mi 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang zhig gnod pa med na mi 'byung ba //
translated: If patience does not arise without an object,

original: gnod byed gang zhig yod na bzod pa 'byung //
analyzed: gnod byed gang zhig yod na bzod pa 'byung //
translated: and if patience arises when there is an object,

original: gnod byed de nyid bzod pa'i rgyu yin pas //
analyzed: gnod byed de nyid bzod pa'i rgyu yin pas //
translated: then the object itself is the cause of patience.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i de gegs ji ltar yin //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i de gegs ji ltar yin //
translated: How can it be an obstacle to the skillful means?

original: dpe bshad de /üîΩsbyin bdag gi sbyin pa'i dus la sleb pa'i 'dod mkhan gyis /
analyzed: dpe bshad de / sbyin bdag gi sbyin pa'i dus la sleb pa'i 'dod mkhan gyis /
translated: I have explained the example.üîΩHow can the one who desires the time of the benefactor‚Äôs generosity

original: sbyin pa'i bar chad byed par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bar chad byed par ga la 'gyur //
translated: be an obstacle to generosity?

original: de bzhin du rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pas mkhan po thob pas na rab tu 'byung ba'i gegs byar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pas mkhan po thob pas na rab tu 'byung ba'i gegs byar mi rigs so //
translated: In the same way, it is not right to obstruct the going forth of someone who wants to go forth, because he has found a preceptor.

original: gzhan yang bsod nams ma bsags pa mang bas nor 'dod pa ni rnyed par sla'i /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsod nams ma bsags pa mang bas nor 'dod pa ni rnyed par sla'i /
translated: Moreover, it is easy to find someone who wants wealth, because there are many who have not accumulated merit.

original: gnod byed ni ma yin te rgyu mtshan med par mi 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gnod byed ni ma yin te rgyu mtshan med par mi 'byung bas so //
translated: But it is not easy to find someone who wants to harm you, because there is no reason for it.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan la gnod pa las bzlog pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan la gnod pa las bzlog pa na /
translated: Therefore, when you turn away from harming others,

original: bdag la sus kyang gnod pa mi byed do //
analyzed: bdag la sus kyang gnod pa mi byed do //
translated: no one will harm you.

original: de bas khyim du byung ba'i gter du 'bad pa med par thob pa'i dgra bo la dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas khyim du byung ba'i gter du 'bad pa med par thob pa'i dgra bo la dga' bar bya'o //
translated: So you should be happy with an enemy, who is like a treasure that has come to your house without any effort on your part.

original: byang chub spyod pa'i tshogs sogs pa'i grogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub spyod pa'i tshogs sogs pa'i grogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is a companion in the practice of the bodhisattva deeds.

original: de bas bzod pa 'di dag bzod pa bsgom pa dang / 'di gnod pa byed pa gnyis kyis bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas bzod pa 'di dag bzod pa bsgom pa dang / 'di gnod pa byed pa gnyis kyis bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, you should accomplish patience by means of these two: patience in the face of the harm inflicted by others, and patience in voluntarily accepting suffering.

original: chos rtogs pa 'di thog mar 'di la sbyin gyi gdul bya gzhan la phyis zhes smon lam bya'o //
analyzed: chos rtogs pa 'di thog mar 'di la sbyin gyi gdul bya gzhan la phyis zhes smon lam bya'o //
translated: And you should make this aspiration: ‚ÄúFirst I will give this realization of the Dharma to this person who is harming me, and then to other disciples.‚Äù

original: ji ltar byams pa'i stobs byang chub sems @235a * //
analyzed: ji ltar byams pa'i stobs byang chub sems @235a * //
translated: Just as the power of love of the bodhisattva

original: dpas lnga sde la ltos nas smon lam byas pa gang gi phyir 'di sngon du 'gro ba bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: dpas lnga sde la ltos nas smon lam byas pa gang gi phyir 'di sngon du 'gro ba bzod pa yin no //
translated: in regard to the group of five, which was the basis of his aspiration, is patience.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa grub par gyur cig ces pa'i bsam pa gnod byed la med pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa grub par gyur cig ces pa'i bsam pa gnod byed la med pas /
translated: The bodhisattva's patience is accomplished, because the intention to harm is absent in the one who is harmed.

original: bsod nams bzod pa'i rgyu yin kyang mchod par 'os pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams bzod pa'i rgyu yin kyang mchod par 'os pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Even though merit is the cause of patience, it is not worthy of worship.

original: dge ba rdzogs pa'i rgyu dam pa'i chos bsam pa gang yang med pas ji ltar mchod /
analyzed: dge ba rdzogs pa'i rgyu dam pa'i chos bsam pa gang yang med pas ji ltar mchod /
translated: Since there is no intention to complete virtue, the holy Dharma, how can it be worshipped?

original: gal te gnod pa'i bsam pa dgra la yod pas 'dir mchod ce na /
analyzed: gal te gnod pa'i bsam pa dgra la yod pas 'dir mchod ce na /
translated: If it is said that it is worshipped here because the intention to harm exists in the enemy,

original: smras pa / gnod pa'i bsam pa 'di la med pa na bdag gi bzod pa ga la 'grub /
analyzed: smras pa / gnod pa'i bsam pa 'di la med pa na bdag gi bzod pa ga la 'grub /
translated: it is said: Since the intention to harm is absent here, how can my patience be accomplished?

original: dper na phan pa dang bde ba byed pa'i sman pa las bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phan pa dang bde ba byed pa'i sman pa las bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a doctor who brings benefit and happiness.

original: gang gi phyir gnod byed la zhe sdang mi byed na bzod pa 'grub po //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod byed la zhe sdang mi byed na bzod pa 'grub po //
translated: Because one does not give rise to hatred towards the one who causes harm, patience is accomplished.

original: de bas de'i bsam pa ngan pa kho na la brten nas bzod pa skye'o //
analyzed: de bas de'i bsam pa ngan pa kho na la brten nas bzod pa skye'o //
translated: Therefore, patience is produced only in dependence on his evil thoughts.

original: de bas de nyid bzod pa'i rgyu yin pas dam pa'i chos bzhin mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas de nyid bzod pa'i rgyu yin pas dam pa'i chos bzhin mchod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since he is the cause of patience, he should be worshipped like the holy Dharma.

original: gnod byed tshogs kyi rgyu yin par lung gis grub cing bshad de /
analyzed: gnod byed tshogs kyi rgyu yin par lung gis grub cing bshad de /
translated: The collection of those who do harm is established by scripture and explanation as the cause of the perfection of patience.

original: sems can rnams dang rgyal ba rnams mgu bar byed pa'i zhing yin par thub pa sangs rgyas kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams dang rgyal ba rnams mgu bar byed pa'i zhing yin par thub pa sangs rgyas kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Sage, the Buddha, has said that sentient beings are the field for pleasing the Conquerors.

original: gang gi phyir 'di thams cad mgu bar byas nas mang po zhig phun sum tshogs pa'i mthar thug sangs rgyas nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di thams cad mgu bar byas nas mang po zhig phun sum tshogs pa'i mthar thug sangs rgyas nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because, after pleasing them all, many will realize Buddhahood, the ultimate perfection.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas dang mnyam zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas dang mnyam zhe na /
translated: How are they equal to the Buddhas?

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs la sogs pa gnyi ga las rtogs pa mnyam pa la /
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs la sogs pa gnyi ga las rtogs pa mnyam pa la /
translated: It is said: The realization of the Buddha qualities, the powers, etc. is equal in both.

original: rgyal ba la mgu ba ltar sems can la mi byed pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: rgyal ba la mgu ba ltar sems can la mi byed pa mi rigs so //
translated: It is not right that you do not please sentient beings as you do the Conquerors.

original: sems can zhe sdang la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bcas pas rgyal ba dang ji ltar mnyam zhe na /
analyzed: sems can zhe sdang la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bcas pas rgyal ba dang ji ltar mnyam zhe na /
translated: How can sentient beings, who have the defilements of hatred, etc., be equal to the Victor?

original: smras pa / bsam pa'i bdag nyid che bar rang bzhin gyis 'dir ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / bsam pa'i bdag nyid che bar rang bzhin gyis 'dir ma yin te /
translated: It is not in terms of the greatness of their intrinsic reality that they are equal to the Victor.

original: 'on kyang byang chub ces bya ba'i 'bras bu byed pa la nus pa mnyam pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub ces bya ba'i 'bras bu byed pa la nus pa mnyam pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: But in terms of the equality of their potential for the effect called enlightenment.

original: de la bdag nyid chen po mnyam pas sems can dag rgyal ba rnams dang mnyam mo ;
analyzed: de la bdag nyid chen po mnyam pas sems can dag rgyal ba rnams dang mnyam mo ;
translated: In that, the great beings, the sentient beings, are equal to the Victors.

original: /'di nyid la rigs pas bshad de /
analyzed: /'di nyid la rigs pas bshad de /
translated: This is explained by reasoning.

original: sems can rnams la byams pa sgom pa po skye bo rnams kyis mchod pa gang de ni sems can bdag nyid che ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la byams pa sgom pa po skye bo rnams kyis mchod pa gang de ni sems can bdag nyid che ba nyid yin te /
translated: The worship of sentient beings by those who cultivate love is due to the greatness of sentient beings themselves.

original: dper na sangs rgyas la sems dang bar byas pas bsod nams gang 'byung ba de sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid tshe bar brjod @235b pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sangs rgyas la sems dang bar byas pas bsod nams gang 'byung ba de sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid tshe bar brjod @235b pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, just as the merit that arises from faith in the Buddha is said to be due to the greatness of the Buddha.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thob pa'i rgyu yin pas rgyal ba dang mnyam par bshad /
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thob pa'i rgyu yin pas rgyal ba dang mnyam par bshad /
translated: Therefore, they are said to be equal to the Victor because they are the cause of attaining the qualities of the Buddha.

original: don dam par rgyal ba dang mnyam pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: don dam par rgyal ba dang mnyam pa gang yang med de /
translated: In the ultimate sense, there is no one equal to the Victorious One.

original: gang dag gis yon tan rnams kyi cha shas la yang mtha' med pa /
analyzed: gang dag gis yon tan rnams kyi cha shas la yang mtha' med pa /
translated: There is no end to the parts of his qualities.

original: de lta bu yon tan rin po che'i 'byung gnas rnams dang mtshungs pa ga la srid /
analyzed: de lta bu yon tan rin po che'i 'byung gnas rnams dang mtshungs pa ga la srid /
translated: How could there be anyone similar to him, the source of precious qualities?

original: gang gi phyir yon tan gyi snying po rnams kyi phung po gcig pu'i yon tan phra rab tsam yang gal te sems can gang rung cig la mthong bar gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yon tan gyi snying po rnams kyi phung po gcig pu'i yon tan phra rab tsam yang gal te sems can gang rung cig la mthong bar gyur na /
translated: For, if one were to see even the smallest particle of a quality of the heap of the essence of his qualities in any sentient being,

original: de mchod pa la khams gsum las byung ba'i rin po che la sogs pa rnams 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de mchod pa la khams gsum las byung ba'i rin po che la sogs pa rnams 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: it would not be appropriate for the jewels of the three worlds to be offered to him.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa na nyon mongs pa srin po'i shugs kyis sems can la gnod pa dpag tu med pa byas yod /
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa na nyon mongs pa srin po'i shugs kyis sems can la gnod pa dpag tu med pa byas yod /
translated: In beginningless cyclic existence, sentient beings have been harmed by the force of the demon of the afflictions to an immeasurable degree.

original: de'i lan po sems can mgu bar byed pa las gzhan thabs gang yang med do //
analyzed: de'i lan po sems can mgu bar byed pa las gzhan thabs gang yang med do //
translated: There is no method other than pleasing sentient beings to repay them.

original: de byas nas sems dri ma med pa la stobs bcu la sogs pa gsal bar snang ngo //
analyzed: de byas nas sems dri ma med pa la stobs bcu la sogs pa gsal bar snang ngo //
translated: When that is done, the ten powers and so forth appear clearly in the stainless mind.

original: cha shas 'di dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba 'di yin pas /
analyzed: cha shas 'di dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba 'di yin pas /
translated: Since this action is in accordance with this part,

original: de byas nas sangs rgyas la mchod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de byas nas sangs rgyas la mchod par 'gyur te /
translated: having done it, one will make offerings to the Buddha,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba'i cho ga byas pas so //üîΩgzhan yang bcos pa ma yin pa'i gnyen phan mtha' yas pa btags pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba'i cho ga byas pas so // gzhan yang bcos pa ma yin pa'i gnyen phan mtha' yas pa btags pa /
translated: because one will have performed the ritual that the Lord has permitted.üîΩMoreover, there is no one who is not pleased by sentient beings, who are infinite and who have been related to one as friends,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams phan btags pa'i lan pos sems can mgu bar byed pa ma yin pa de med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams phan btags pa'i lan pos sems can mgu bar byed pa ma yin pa de med de /
translated: because the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are not pleased by the repayment of their assistance.

original: de dag la rang don bsgrub tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la rang don bsgrub tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For them, there is no accomplishment of their own goal.

original: gang gi phyir rgyal ba rnams rang gi sku'i phyag dang zhabs dang dbu la sogs pa gcod pa dang / mnar med kyi dmyal bar 'jug pa des na sems can gdon pa'i phyir sems can de dag la phan pa byas na rgyal ba rnams la phan pa byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyal ba rnams rang gi sku'i phyag dang zhabs dang dbu la sogs pa gcod pa dang / mnar med kyi dmyal bar 'jug pa des na sems can gdon pa'i phyir sems can de dag la phan pa byas na rgyal ba rnams la phan pa byas par 'gyur /
translated: For the sake of liberating sentient beings, the Victors cut off their own limbs, hands, feet, heads, and so on, and enter the Avici hell. Therefore, if one helps those sentient beings, one will have helped the Victors.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des gnod pa byed pa rnams la yang dge ba kho na byed pa yin gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa la mnyes pa byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des gnod pa byed pa rnams la yang dge ba kho na byed pa yin gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa la mnyes pa byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he should do only what is virtuous even with regard to those who do him harm. Otherwise, he would not be pleasing the Tathagatas.üîΩHe should please the gurus,

original: bla ma la mnyes pa byed par bshad de ;
analyzed: bla ma la mnyes pa byed par bshad de ;
translated: as explained in the Ratnamegha-sutra:

original: bdag gi rjer gyur pa rgyal ba rnams gang dag gi ched du bskul yang ltos pa med pa lta zhog / rtsva bzhin du rang gi sku gtod ba na bdag bran yin yang rje bu rnams la ci ste nga rgyal byed /
analyzed: bdag gi rjer gyur pa rgyal ba rnams gang dag gi ched du bskul yang ltos pa med pa lta zhog / rtsva bzhin du rang gi sku gtod ba na bdag bran yin yang rje bu rnams la ci ste nga rgyal byed /
translated: ‚ÄúThe Victorious Ones are my masters. I am their servant. How can I be proud, even though I am a servant, when they give themselves up for others without regard, and give up their bodies as if they were grass?‚Äù

original: bran du mi byed bdag la smad //üîΩyid du mi 'ong ba'i bu rnams lta bu gang dag bde na dga' bar 'gyur @236a * //
analyzed: bran du mi byed bdag la smad // yid du mi 'ong ba'i bu rnams lta bu gang dag bde na dga' bar 'gyur @236a * //
translated: ‚ÄúI am not their servant, I am their slave!‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúI am not even fit to be their servant or slave, because they are not distressed by the suffering of the hells and other states, and they are not attached to their own happiness, but are devoted to benefiting others.

original: ba dang ; gang la gnod pa byas pas mya ngan du 'jug / chags sdang med kyang sman lam gyi mthus rgyal ba la 'di ltar 'byung /
analyzed: ba dang ; gang la gnod pa byas pas mya ngan du 'jug / chags sdang med kyang sman lam gyi mthus rgyal ba la 'di ltar 'byung /
translated: They are like parents whose only child has become ill.üîΩThey are not distressed by their own suffering, but are devoted to curing their child‚Äôs illness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni dngos su'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni dngos su'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas do this directly,üîΩand the Buddhas do it by the power of their previous aspirations.

original: gzhan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: thugs rje kho na gsal bar bshad de /
analyzed: thugs rje kho na gsal bar bshad de /
translated: Compassion is explained as being just that.

original: ji ltar yan lag thams cad la khyab cing lus 'bar ba'i mi la 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga kas kyang yid bde bar mi 'gyur ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag thams cad la khyab cing lus 'bar ba'i mi la 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga kas kyang yid bde bar mi 'gyur ba ltar /
translated: Just as a person whose body is on fire and who is pervaded by that fire does not have mental satisfaction through the five sense objects,

original: sems can la gnod pa 'byung na thugs rje can rnams la mnyes pa'i thabs med do //
analyzed: sems can la gnod pa 'byung na thugs rje can rnams la mnyes pa'i thabs med do //
translated: so when sentient beings are harmed, those who have compassion have no means of being pleased.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since that is so,

original: bdag gi skye bo rnams sdug par byas la rgyal ba rnams sdug bsngal bar byas pa gang yin pa de sdig pa de ring bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi skye bo rnams sdug par byas la rgyal ba rnams sdug bsngal bar byas pa gang yin pa de sdig pa de ring bshags par bya ste /
translated: whatever I have done to make my people suffer and to make the Victors suffer, that evil I confess today.

original: bdag gis gang mi dge ba byas pa de thub pa rnams kyis bzod par gsol /
analyzed: bdag gis gang mi dge ba byas pa de thub pa rnams kyis bzod par gsol /
translated: Whatever non-virtue I have done, I beg the forbearance of the Muni.

original: bdag bu yin pas bdag la thugs rje yod pas so //
analyzed: bdag bu yin pas bdag la thugs rje yod pas so //
translated: Since I am a son, I have compassion for myself.

original: mos pa bstan par bshad de /
analyzed: mos pa bstan par bshad de /
translated: Devotion is explained as being taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas, etc., are easy to understand.

original: kun rdzob tu thugs rje chen po'i dbang du gyur pas 'gro ba ma lus pa bdag tu 'dzin pa 'di la the tshom med /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu thugs rje chen po'i dbang du gyur pas 'gro ba ma lus pa bdag tu 'dzin pa 'di la the tshom med /
translated: Since they are under the sway of great compassion on the conventional level, there is no doubt that they cherish all beings as themselves.

original: gzhan du na 'tshang rgya ba mi srid pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'tshang rgya ba mi srid pas so //
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible for them to attain enlightenment.

original: bdag dang gzhan brje ba shin tu goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan brje ba shin tu goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is because they are so thoroughly accustomed to exchanging themselves for others.

original: de bas sems can gyi ngo bor mthong ba 'di dag mgon po kho na yin pas 'dir mi mgu ba'i rigs pa med do //
analyzed: de bas sems can gyi ngo bor mthong ba 'di dag mgon po kho na yin pas 'dir mi mgu ba'i rigs pa med do //
translated: So, since these beings whom we see as having the nature of sentient beings are in fact the very lords themselves, there is no reason to be displeased with them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par byed pa ni sems can mgu bar byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par byed pa ni sems can mgu bar byed pa kho na yin te /
translated: It is by pleasing sentient beings that we please the tathagatas.

original: bshad pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rigs pas so //
translated: This is so, as the reasoning given in the scriptures shows.

original: rang don bsgrubs pa yang 'di yin te sems can mgu bar byas pa'i le lan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang don bsgrubs pa yang 'di yin te sems can mgu bar byas pa'i le lan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is by accomplishing the benefit of others that we accomplish our own benefit, for the latter is the result of pleasing sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal sel ba yang 'di nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal sel ba yang 'di nyid de /
translated: It is by pleasing sentient beings that we dispel the sufferings of the world.

original: des byas pa'i gnod pa la bzod pa byas pas de dag mos pa la lam sbyar bas so //
analyzed: des byas pa'i gnod pa la bzod pa byas pas de dag mos pa la lam sbyar bas so //
translated: For by being patient with the harm that they do, we apply ourselves to the path of pleasing them.

original: bsgrub bya gsum ka bsgrubs pas 'di nyid bdag gi brtul zhugs nges par shog /
analyzed: bsgrub bya gsum ka bsgrubs pas 'di nyid bdag gi brtul zhugs nges par shog /
translated: By accomplishing all three of these goals, may this [bodhisattva conduct] definitely become my spiritual practice.

original: rigs pa gzhan bshad de /
analyzed: rigs pa gzhan bshad de /
translated: Another reason is stated:

original: ji ltar rgyal po'i mi gcig pu yin yang skye ba'i tshogs chen po la yang gnod pa byed /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po'i mi gcig pu yin yang skye ba'i tshogs chen po la yang gnod pa byed /
translated: Just as a single man who is a king's man can harm a great multitude of people,

original: skye bo'i tshogs mig rgyang ring ba ni phyis rgyal po'i gnod pa mthong bas gcig pu de la gnod par mi byed do //
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs mig rgyang ring ba ni phyis rgyal po'i gnod pa mthong bas gcig pu de la gnod par mi byed do //
translated: so a single man who is a bodhisattva's man can harm the whole world, because the multitude of people have long-range vision and see the harm that will come later from the king.

original: gang gi phyir de gcig pu kho na ma yin gyi rgyal @236b po'i thabs de stobs ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de gcig pu kho na ma yin gyi rgyal @236b po'i thabs de stobs ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that [the king's man] is alone in doing this, but rather that the king's power is great.

original: dpe de bzhin du gzhan lta zhog stobs med pa la yang smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dpe de bzhin du gzhan lta zhog stobs med pa la yang smad par mi bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should not despise even a weak person, let alone a powerful one.

original: gang gi phyir stobs med kyi gnod byed la gshin rje'i pho nya rnams dang / snying rje dang ldan pa lha la sogs pas gnod nan byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir stobs med kyi gnod byed la gshin rje'i pho nya rnams dang / snying rje dang ldan pa lha la sogs pas gnod nan byed do //
translated: Because even a weak person who is harmed by others will be harmed by the messengers of the Lord of Death and by compassionate gods and so forth.

original: de bas sems can rnams mgu bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bas sems can rnams mgu bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should please sentient beings.

original: ji ltar rgyal po gtum po dam pa kun gyis ci 'dod byas pas /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po gtum po dam pa kun gyis ci 'dod byas pas /
translated: Just as a fierce king is pleased by everyone doing what he wants,

original: mgu bar byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mgu bar byed pa bzhin no //
translated: as when one pleases a king.

original: gsungs pa bas lhag pa bshad de /
analyzed: gsungs pa bas lhag pa bshad de /
translated: But the bodhisattva's patience is superior to that.

original: rgyal po khros na nor 'phrogs pa dang tha mar gsod nus kyi dmyal bar gtong mi nus so //
analyzed: rgyal po khros na nor 'phrogs pa dang tha mar gsod nus kyi dmyal bar gtong mi nus so //
translated: For a king, even if angered, can only take away one's wealth and even life, but cannot cast one into hell.

original: sems can rnams sdug tu bcug pas dmyal bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams sdug tu bcug pas dmyal bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: But when one has made sentient beings suffer, one goes to hell.

original: rgyal po mnyes nas nor la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa kho na ster gyi sangs rgyas nyid ster mi nus so //
analyzed: rgyal po mnyes nas nor la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa kho na ster gyi sangs rgyas nyid ster mi nus so //
translated: And when one has pleased the king, he gives only the excellence of wealth, etc., but cannot give buddhahood.

original: gang sems can mgu bar byas pas thob pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang sems can mgu bar byas pas thob pa kho na'o //
translated: But when one has pleased sentient beings, one attains just that.

original: skye ba 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu bshad de /
analyzed: skye ba 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu bshad de /
translated: The result in this very life is explained:

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa'i sems can dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa'i sems can dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The sentient beings who have patience are happy.

original: de nas grags pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nas grags pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Then, fame arises.

original: dgra bo med pas skyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bo med pas skyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no enemy, one is happy.

original: skye ba gzhan du zhe sdang la sogs pa med pas dang ba 'dren pa'i lus dang / nad med pa dang / rgyun du dga' ba dang / yun rings gson pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩchos rnams de kho na nyid du spyod pa /
analyzed: skye ba gzhan du zhe sdang la sogs pa med pas dang ba 'dren pa'i lus dang / nad med pa dang / rgyun du dga' ba dang / yun rings gson pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i bde ba thob par 'gyur ro // chos rnams de kho na nyid du spyod pa /
translated: In other lives, he will have a body that inspires confidence, because he will be free of hatred and so on, and he will have good health, constant happiness, a long life, and the bliss of a world-emperor.

original: chos rnams ma skyes pa yin no zhes bzod pa ni chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams ma skyes pa yin no zhes bzod pa ni chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The acceptance that phenomena are not produced is the acceptance that realizes the nature of phenomena.

original: bzod pa'i le'u'i dgongs pa'i 'grel pa khyad par gsal byed ces bya ba ste drug pa'o /
analyzed: bzod pa'i le'u'i dgongs pa'i 'grel pa khyad par gsal byed ces bya ba ste drug pa'o /
translated: This concludes ‚ÄúA Special Clarification: A Commentary on the Intention of the Chapter on Patience,‚Äù the sixth chapter of this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-Fulfilling Gem of Sublime Dharma.

original: // / de ltar bshad pa'i rigs pas bzod pa dang ldan pa brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: // / de ltar bshad pa'i rigs pas bzod pa dang ldan pa brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: Through the reasoning explained above, someone who has patience will make an effort in diligence.

original: ma bzod na pham par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: ma bzod na pham par 'gyur bas so //
translated: If one does not have patience, one will be defeated.

original: gang gi phyir brtson 'grus la 'tshang rgya ba nyid gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtson 'grus la 'tshang rgya ba nyid gnas pa yin no //
translated: For this reason, the state of buddhahood itself is based on diligence.

original: brtson 'grus med na bsod nams kyi tshogs mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus med na bsod nams kyi tshogs mi 'byung ste /
translated: If one does not have diligence, the accumulation of merit will not occur.

original: ji ltar brkyang ba dang bskum pa la sogs pa'i g-yo ba rlung med na mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar brkyang ba dang bskum pa la sogs pa'i g-yo ba rlung med na mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as movement such as stretching and bending does not occur without wind.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na smras pa /
translated: What is the characteristic of energy?

original: dge ba la spro ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba la spro ba'o //
translated: It is the delight in virtue.

original: mi dge ba la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ni le lo kho na'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ni le lo kho na'o //
translated: Laziness is the delight in nonvirtue.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / thos pa la sogs pa rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / thos pa la sogs pa rtsom pa'o //
translated: Energy is the undertaking of virtue such as generosity and the undertaking of listening to the teachings and so on.

original: des spang bar bya ba yin pas de'i dgra bshad de /
analyzed: des spang bar bya ba yin pas de'i dgra bshad de /
translated: It is explained to be the enemy of that which is to be abandoned by it.

original: 'joms par byed @237a * //
analyzed: 'joms par byed @237a * //
translated: It is the adversary of laziness.

original: pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni le lo ste lus la sogs pa las su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni le lo ste lus la sogs pa las su mi rung ba'o //
translated: Laziness is the unserviceability of the body and so on.

original: ngan pa rgod pa la sogs pa la zhen pa dang / byed pa dka' ba la sogs pa sems log pa ni sgyid lug dang / des rang la ma nus pa smod pa ni bdag nyid brnyas pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pa rgod pa la sogs pa la zhen pa dang / byed pa dka' ba la sogs pa sems log pa ni sgyid lug dang / des rang la ma nus pa smod pa ni bdag nyid brnyas pa'o //
translated: The mind is discouraged by the difficulty of the task and so on.

original: le lo'i rgyu bshad de /
analyzed: le lo'i rgyu bshad de /
translated: The cause of laziness is explained.

original: snyom las kho na bde ba ste /
analyzed: snyom las kho na bde ba ste /
translated: Laziness is the delight in pleasure.

original: de la zhen pa dang gang rung bsten par 'dod pa 'di dag kyang srid pa'i sdug bsngal la skyo ba mi skye bas 'byung /
analyzed: de la zhen pa dang gang rung bsten par 'dod pa 'di dag kyang srid pa'i sdug bsngal la skyo ba mi skye bas 'byung /
translated: These desires to cling to and enjoy them arise from not being disgusted with the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: 'di dag las le lo 'byung /
analyzed: 'di dag las le lo 'byung /
translated: From these arise laziness.üîΩThe antidote to laziness is explained.

original: de la le lo'i gnyen po bshad de nyon mongs pa kho rgya bas bshor te des zin pa /üîΩskye ba kho na rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de la le lo'i gnyen po bshad de nyon mongs pa kho rgya bas bshor te des zin pa / skye ba kho na rgyu yin te /
translated: The cause of laziness is the afflictions.

original: de'i nang du chud pa de bas gshin rje'i khar chud pa zhes da dung mi shes sam /
analyzed: de'i nang du chud pa de bas gshin rje'i khar chud pa zhes da dung mi shes sam /
translated: You have not understood that being born is like being seized by the Lord of Death, and being born is the cause of being seized by the Lord of Death.

original: skyes nas nges par 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes nas nges par 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you are definitely going to die after being born.

original: yang skyo ba'i rgyu bshad de /
analyzed: yang skyo ba'i rgyu bshad de /
translated: The cause of disgust is explained.

original: rang gi sde ni rang gi rigs te /
analyzed: rang gi sde ni rang gi rigs te /
translated: Your own group is your own class.

original: de 'chi bdag gi rim pas khyer ba ma mthong ngam /
analyzed: de 'chi bdag gi rim pas khyer ba ma mthong ngam /
translated: Have you not seen that it is carried off by the stages of the Lord of Death?

original: khyod kyang de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod kyang de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: You will also become like that.

original: dper na nges par gsad par bya ba'i ma he rang sde bsad kyang gti mug gis rig par mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nges par gsad par bya ba'i ma he rang sde bsad kyang gti mug gis rig par mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a buffalo to be killed is killed by its own group, but it is unable to understand because of delusion.

original: 'chi bdag gis mgul ba bteg nas bltas pa 'bros pa'i lam kun bkag pa khyod ji ltar bza' bar 'dod pa dang / gnyid dang dga' byed nus /
analyzed: 'chi bdag gis mgul ba bteg nas bltas pa 'bros pa'i lam kun bkag pa khyod ji ltar bza' bar 'dod pa dang / gnyid dang dga' byed nus /
translated: The Lord of Death will look at your throat and block all the paths of escape. How will you be able to eat, sleep, or enjoy yourself?

original: gal te da lta le lo mi spong na ;
analyzed: gal te da lta le lo mi spong na ;
translated: If you do not abandon laziness right now,

original: gang gi tshe nad dang rgas pa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa grabs su chud nas myur du 'chi ba 'ong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nad dang rgas pa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa grabs su chud nas myur du 'chi ba 'ong bar 'gyur /
translated: when the collection of illness, aging, and so forth are prepared and ready, then death will quickly come.

original: de'i tshe le lo spangs nas kyang ci /
analyzed: de'i tshe le lo spangs nas kyang ci /
translated: At that time, what will you do even if you abandon laziness?

original: 'di ma 'ongs pa ma thob pa dang / 'di byed par 'dod pas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di ma 'ongs pa ma thob pa dang / 'di byed par 'dod pas brtsams te /
translated: You have not obtained what is in the future, and you have not even begun to do what you want to do.

original: 'di ni phyed zin pas mthar ma phyin pa kho na la glo bur du 'chi ba 'ong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni phyed zin pas mthar ma phyin pa kho na la glo bur du 'chi ba 'ong bar 'gyur /
translated: You have not even completed half of it. Death will suddenly come right in the middle of it.

original: kyi hud bcom zhes bsams shing khyod ci byed bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kyi hud bcom zhes bsams shing khyod ci byed bar 'gyur /
translated: What will you do when you think, ‚ÄúAlas, I am ruined!‚Äù

original: nye du dang bral ba'i mya ngan gyi shugs kyis skrangs pa'i mchi ma dang bcas pa /
analyzed: nye du dang bral ba'i mya ngan gyi shugs kyis skrangs pa'i mchi ma dang bcas pa /
translated: You will be filled with the strength of the sorrow of being separated from your relatives and will be swollen with tears.

original: dmar por gyur pa'i mig gis blta ba'i re thag chad pa'i nyi du rnams dang / gshin rje'i pho nya rnams kyis bzhin la blta zhing /üîΩrang gis byas pa'i sdig pa dran pas /üîΩ'chi bdag rang gi lag gis dug zos zhes phyis 'gyod bas gdungs pa dang / sdug tu bcug pa'i sdug bsngal gyi skrag pa'i dmyal ba'i sgra thos nas /
analyzed: dmar por gyur pa'i mig gis blta ba'i re thag chad pa'i nyi du rnams dang / gshin rje'i pho nya rnams kyis bzhin la blta zhing / rang gis byas pa'i sdig pa dran pas / 'chi bdag rang gi lag gis dug zos zhes phyis 'gyod bas gdungs pa dang / sdug tu bcug pa'i sdug bsngal gyi skrag pa'i dmyal ba'i sgra thos nas /
translated: The messengers of the Lord of Death are looking at your face.üîΩYou remember the sins you have committed, and you are tormented by the thought, ‚ÄúI have taken poison with my own hand, the Lord of Death.‚ÄùüîΩYou hear the terrifying sounds of the hells, and you are terrified, thinking, ‚ÄúMy situation will be like this.‚Äù

original: bdag gi gnas skabs kyang 'di ltar 'gyur zhes skrag pa byung ba'i bshad @237b pa yis lus la sogs pas myos par 'gyur tshe ci zhig bya /
analyzed: bdag gi gnas skabs kyang 'di ltar 'gyur zhes skrag pa byung ba'i bshad @237b pa yis lus la sogs pas myos par 'gyur tshe ci zhig bya /
translated: What will you do when you are confused by the explanation of the terror of the sufferings you have brought on yourself?

original: dper na ji ltar nya gson po kho na chus gang ba'i bum pa la sogs par bzhag nas 'dod pa de'i tshe gsod /
analyzed: dper na ji ltar nya gson po kho na chus gang ba'i bum pa la sogs par bzhag nas 'dod pa de'i tshe gsod /
translated: For example, just as you want to kill a live fish that is placed in a pot filled with water,

original: de bzhin du bdag kyang 'chi bdag kyang 'chi bdag gis yin zhes shes nas mi'i yul kho nar khyod 'jigs par rigs /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag kyang 'chi bdag kyang 'chi bdag gis yin zhes shes nas mi'i yul kho nar khyod 'jigs par rigs /
translated: in the same way, you should know that you are also the Lord of Death, and you should be afraid of the human realm.

original: sdig pa byas nas dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal la 'jigs pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: sdig pa byas nas dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal la 'jigs pa lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention the fear of the sufferings of hell after committing evil deeds?

original: kye gzhon sha can chu dron pos reg kyang shin tu snyi bas rab tu tsha bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kye gzhon sha can chu dron pos reg kyang shin tu snyi bas rab tu tsha bar 'gyur /
translated: Alas, you tender youth, even the touch of warm water is extremely painful for you.

original: lhag ma go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: bde ba bskyed pa'i rgyu bskyed pa la brtson pa med pa de'i 'bras bu bde ba 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal mi bzod cing gnod pa mang ba dang ; 'chi bdag gis bzung bzhin du 'chi ba med pa'i rnam pa can /
analyzed: bde ba bskyed pa'i rgyu bskyed pa la brtson pa med pa de'i 'bras bu bde ba 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal mi bzod cing gnod pa mang ba dang ; 'chi bdag gis bzung bzhin du 'chi ba med pa'i rnam pa can /
translated: You who are not diligent in creating the causes for happiness, you who desire happiness and cannot bear suffering, you who are full of harm, you who are seized by the Lord of Death, you who are like one who is immortal,

original: de ltar 'khrul pa khyod kyi sdug bsngal can gyi kyi hud sdug bsngal dag gis bcom//
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul pa khyod kyi sdug bsngal can gyi kyi hud sdug bsngal dag gis bcom//
translated: Alas, you who are deluded, you who are overcome by suffering, you who are full of suffering,

original: mi khom pa brgyad spangs nas thob pa'i mi lus kho na gru yin te /
analyzed: mi khom pa brgyad spangs nas thob pa'i mi lus kho na gru yin te /
translated: Having abandoned the eight unfavorable conditions and obtained the human body, which is the very boat,

original: de brten nas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin chu bo chen po sgrol cig / brtson 'grus kyi lam du phyogs nas so //
analyzed: de brten nas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin chu bo chen po sgrol cig / brtson 'grus kyi lam du phyogs nas so //
translated: Relying on it, cross the great river of suffering, having set out on the path of diligence.

original: kye rmongs pa gnyid log pa'i dus 'di ma yin /
analyzed: kye rmongs pa gnyid log pa'i dus 'di ma yin /
translated: Alas, you who are deluded, this is not the time to sleep.

original: phyis ngan song du gru ni rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: phyis ngan song du gru ni rnyed par dka'o //
translated: Later, it will be difficult to find a boat to the lower realms.

original: de ltar le lo bkag nas ngan la chags pa bkag par bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar le lo bkag nas ngan la chags pa bkag par bshad de /
translated: Having thus prohibited laziness, he explains the prohibition of attachment to evil:

original: dge ba'i las la dga' ba mchog //
analyzed: dge ba'i las la dga' ba mchog //
translated: Delight in virtue is supreme.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: bde 'gro'i rgyun skyed pas dga' ba'i rgyu mtha' yas pa dor nas /
analyzed: bde 'gro'i rgyun skyed pas dga' ba'i rgyu mtha' yas pa dor nas /
translated: Having abandoned the infinite causes of delight that produce the continuity of good destinies,

original: g-yeng ba ni lus dang sems khengs pa dang / rgod pa la sogs pa'i sgras glu la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la /
analyzed: g-yeng ba ni lus dang sems khengs pa dang / rgod pa la sogs pa'i sgras glu la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la /
translated: you delight in distraction, which is the cause of suffering, with the words of a song, such as the swelling of the body and mind, and so on.

original: khyod dga' ba ji ltar rigs /
analyzed: khyod dga' ba ji ltar rigs /
translated: How is it fitting for you to delight in that?

original: kun rang sems la slob pa'o //
analyzed: kun rang sems la slob pa'o //
translated: All of this is taught for the mind.

original: sgyid lug pa la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad 'di gzhan gyis bcug pa yin gyi slob dpon gyi ma yin /
analyzed: sgyid lug pa la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad 'di gzhan gyis bcug pa yin gyi slob dpon gyi ma yin /
translated: This verse on laziness, etc. was inserted by another, not by the master.

original: sdom tshig yin zhe na /
analyzed: sdom tshig yin zhe na /
translated: If it is a summary verse,

original: 'o na le lo'i gnyen po dang / ngan la chags pa dang / bdag nyid brnyas pa'i gnyen po skabs su bab pa ci ste mi 'chad /
analyzed: 'o na le lo'i gnyen po dang / ngan la chags pa dang / bdag nyid brnyas pa'i gnyen po skabs su bab pa ci ste mi 'chad /
translated: then why not explain the antidotes to laziness, attachment to evil, and self-contempt, which are relevant?

analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: It is easy to understand such as my own and so forth.

original: 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa las 'jigs pa ma byed ces mi 'jigs pa ma byin /
analyzed: 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa las 'jigs pa ma byed ces mi 'jigs pa ma byin /
translated: Do not be afraid of the fear of death and so forth, he did not give fearlessness.

original: lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal zad par ma byas pas bde bar yang ma byas //
analyzed: lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal zad par ma byas pas bde bar yang ma byas //
translated: He did not make me happy by exhausting the suffering of body and mind.

original: de bas sdug bsngal la sogs pa don med par bshad /
analyzed: de bas sdug bsngal la sogs pa don med par bshad /
translated: Therefore, he explained the meaninglessness of suffering and so forth.

original: skye ba snga mar chos la 'dun pa ma byas pas de ltar phongs par 'gyur zhes shes nas blo dang ldan pa su zhig chos la 'dun pa gtong zhes bya ba ni chos la 'dun pa bskyed pa'o //üîΩphongs pa bzlog pa 'ba' zhig pa'i ma yin gyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba 'dun par thub pas gsungs 'dun pa de'i yang rtsa ba las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni 'jig
analyzed: skye ba snga mar chos la 'dun pa ma byas pas de ltar phongs par 'gyur zhes shes nas blo dang ldan pa su zhig chos la 'dun pa gtong zhes bya ba ni chos la 'dun pa bskyed pa'o // phongs pa bzlog pa 'ba' zhig pa'i ma yin gyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba 'dun par thub pas gsungs 'dun pa de'i yang rtsa ba las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni 'jig
translated: This is generating interest in the Dharma.

original: rten phyi ma la 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: rten phyi ma la 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa thob pa ste /
translated: Interest is the root of all mundane and transcendent virtue, not just the prevention of poverty. The Muni said that the root of that interest is the obtainment of the desired and undesired results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karmas in the next world.

original: de bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de bsgom pa'o //
translated: This is cultivating interest.

original: de la re zhig mi dge ba'i rnam smin bshad de /
analyzed: de la re zhig mi dge ba'i rnam smin bshad de /
translated: Here, the results of nonvirtue are explained first.

original: lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / gsod pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa sna tshogs dang / 'dod pa btsal zhing ma rnyed pas 'dod pa ma grub pa dag sdig pa byed pa kho na la 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / gsod pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa sna tshogs dang / 'dod pa btsal zhing ma rnyed pas 'dod pa ma grub pa dag sdig pa byed pa kho na la 'byung ngo //
translated: The suffering of body and mind, mental dissatisfaction, the fear of being killed, and so on, and the frustration of desire due to not finding what one wants, occur only for the sinful.

original: dge ba'i rnam smin bshad de //
analyzed: dge ba'i rnam smin bshad de //
translated: The virtuous is explained as having a pleasant fruition.

original: 'dod pa smon pa'i rnam rtog ni yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa smon pa'i rnam rtog ni yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The thought of desire is the mental activity.

original: 'bras bu kho na yon tan de mchod pa lhag ma go sla'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu kho na yon tan de mchod pa lhag ma go sla'o //
translated: The result itself is the virtue. The rest is easy to understand.

original: yang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu bshad de /
analyzed: yang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu bshad de /
translated: The result of nonvirtue is explained.

original: sdig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sinful is the cause.

original: sdug bsngal kho na mtshon yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kho na mtshon yin te /
translated: Suffering is the weapon,

original: de'i 'dod pa gcod pas so //
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa gcod pas so //
translated: because it cuts off the desired result.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rnam smin bshad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rnam smin bshad de /
translated: The virtuous that transcends the world is explained as having a pleasant fruition.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa thob pa kho na bde ba can gyi zhing khams su rgya che ba /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa thob pa kho na bde ba can gyi zhing khams su rgya che ba /
translated: The attainment of the stages of Joyful and so on is the pleasant realm of Sukhavati.üîΩIt is vast,

original: dri bzang ba /
analyzed: dri bzang ba /
translated: fragrant,

original: bsil ba / reg bya bde ba'i padmo'i nang du gnas pa /
analyzed: bsil ba / reg bya bde ba'i padmo'i nang du gnas pa /
translated: cool, and has the pleasant touch of a lotus.

original: rgyal ba'i chos kyi dbyangs yid du 'ong ba'i zas @240a * //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i chos kyi dbyangs yid du 'ong ba'i zas @240a * //
translated: The melodious Dharma of the Victorious One is food that is pleasing to the mind.üîΩ

original: kyis sku'i gzi brjid bskyed par byas pa /
analyzed: kyis sku'i gzi brjid bskyed par byas pa /
translated: The sweet sound of the Dharma of the Victorious Ones is the food that nourishes the body.

original: yongs su smin pa'i dus su de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer ba phye ba'i pad ma las 'khrungs pa /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i dus su de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer ba phye ba'i pad ma las 'khrungs pa /
translated: The light rays of the Tathagata open the lotus from which one is born at the time of full maturity.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad dang ldan pa'i sku de lta bu rgyal ba'i sras bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med kyi mdun du /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad dang ldan pa'i sku de lta bu rgyal ba'i sras bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med kyi mdun du /
translated: Such a body, endowed with the major and minor marks of excellence, is born in the presence of the Victorious One, the Blessed One Amitabha, in a pure land.

original: mtha' gcig tu dge bas skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu dge bas skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the result of exclusively virtuous actions.

original: ma'i mngal nas skye ba rnams la de las bzlog ba sdug bsngal bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ma'i mngal nas skye ba rnams la de las bzlog ba sdug bsngal bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Those who are born from a womb should understand that this is the opposite of what is described above.

original: mtha' gcig gu mi dge ba'i rnam smin bshad de /
analyzed: mtha' gcig gu mi dge ba'i rnam smin bshad de /
translated: The result of exclusively nonvirtuous actions is described as follows:

original: dus kyi pho nyas 'bar ba'i tho ba la sogs pas rdeg pas thams cad pags pa bshus ba dang / shin tu gnod pas nyam thag cing smre sngags 'don pa dang / rab tu tsha ba'i me yis bzhu ba'i zangs zhun lus la blugs par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: dus kyi pho nyas 'bar ba'i tho ba la sogs pas rdeg pas thams cad pags pa bshus ba dang / shin tu gnod pas nyam thag cing smre sngags 'don pa dang / rab tu tsha ba'i me yis bzhu ba'i zangs zhun lus la blugs par gyur pa dang /
translated: The messengers of time strike you with flaming hammers and so forth, and your skin is flayed off. You are tormented by extreme pain and cry out in distress. Molten copper is poured into your body, which is burning with intense heat.

original: 'bar ba'i ral gri dang mdung gis bsnun pas sha'i dum bu brgyar gtubs pas /
analyzed: 'bar ba'i ral gri dang mdung gis bsnun pas sha'i dum bu brgyar gtubs pas /
translated: He is struck by blazing swords and spears, and his flesh is cut into a hundred pieces.

original: de lta bur gyur pa nag po'i las kyis lan du me shin tu 'bar ba'i lcags kyis gzhir ltung ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa nag po'i las kyis lan du me shin tu 'bar ba'i lcags kyis gzhir ltung ste /
translated: In this way, because of black actions, he falls onto a surface of burning iron.

original: de'i las yun ring pos sad pa'i phyir 'dun pa'i stobs nye bar bsdus te bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i las yun ring pos sad pa'i phyir 'dun pa'i stobs nye bar bsdus te bshad pa /
translated: Because his actions ripen over a long time, he is encouraged by the power of aspiration.

original: de bas na bshad pa'i rigs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de bas na bshad pa'i rigs pa bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, in accordance with the reasoning explained,

original: rnam smin goms pa nas dge ba la 'dun pa kho na gus pas bya'o //
analyzed: rnam smin goms pa nas dge ba la 'dun pa kho na gus pas bya'o //
translated: one should only respectfully aspire to virtue, from the ripening of familiarity.

original: da ni nga rgyal gyi stobs bshad de /
analyzed: da ni nga rgyal gyi stobs bshad de /
translated: Now, the power of pride is explained.

original: rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyi mdo las bshad pa'i cho gas rtsom pa brtan pas bsgrub bya'i don du nga rgyal bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyi mdo las bshad pa'i cho gas rtsom pa brtan pas bsgrub bya'i don du nga rgyal bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate pride for the sake of what is to be accomplished by firm practice through the ritual explained in the Vajra Victory Banner S≈´tra.

original: de la dang po nyid du 'byor pa ni sgrub par nus pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po nyid du 'byor pa ni sgrub par nus pa ste /
translated: There, first of all, one is able to accomplish the practice.

original: de brtags nas brtsam par bya'i mi nus na mi brtsam mo //
analyzed: de brtags nas brtsam par bya'i mi nus na mi brtsam mo //
translated: Having examined that, one should begin. If one is unable, one should not begin.

original: dam bca' nyams pa'i phyir ma brtsams pa mchog / brtsams nas ldog pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: dam bca' nyams pa'i phyir ma brtsams pa mchog / brtsams nas ldog pa mi rigs so //
translated: Because one's vow would be impaired, it is best not to begin. Once begun, it is not right to turn back.

original: log pa'i nyes dmigs bshad de /
analyzed: log pa'i nyes dmigs bshad de /
translated: Having explained the faults of the perverted,

original: skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúbirth,‚Äù etc.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba thams cad dang / rgyu mthun dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'byin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba thams cad dang / rgyu mthun dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'byin no //
translated: It produces the homogeneous and the ripened results of all the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: de la rgyu mthun ni rnam pa gnyis te byed pa dang myong ba'i rgyu mthun no //
analyzed: de la rgyu mthun ni rnam pa gnyis te byed pa dang myong ba'i rgyu mthun no //
translated: Among them, the homogeneous is twofold: the homogeneous cause of action and the homogeneous cause of experience.

original: 'di ni byed pa'i rgyu mthun te /
analyzed: 'di ni byed pa'i rgyu mthun te /
translated: This is the homogeneous cause of action.

original: gang dam bca' nyams pas de goms pa'i bag chags kyis skye ba gzhan la yang ngo gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gang dam bca' nyams pas de goms pa'i bag chags kyis skye ba gzhan la yang ngo gsungs pa yang /
translated: Because one has violated one‚Äôs vow, by the instinct of that habit in other lives also one will be untrustworthy.üîΩIt is said:

original: skye ba gcig ni 'bad pa yis //
analyzed: skye ba gcig ni 'bad pa yis //
translated: By the effort of one life

original: mkhas pas dag pa sbyang bar bya //üîΩskye ba'i rgyun gzhan byang chub par //
analyzed: mkhas pas dag pa sbyang bar bya // skye ba'i rgyun gzhan byang chub par //
translated: the wise one purifies the pure.üîΩBy that very thing the stream of births

original: de nyid kyis ni sbyong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni sbyong bar 'gyur //
translated: is purified, and one is enlightened.

original: zhes so // rgyal ba dang bla ma'i bka' las 'das pas byung ba'i sdig pa las sdug bsngal yang 'phel lo //
analyzed: zhes so // rgyal ba dang bla ma'i bka' las 'das pas byung ba'i sdig pa las sdug bsngal yang 'phel lo //
translated: And suffering increases from the sin that arises from transgressing the word of the Conqueror and the guru.

original: @240b gzhan ni thog mar brtsams nas bzhag pa dang / 'bras bu'i dus can ni gzhag pa'i dus su gnyis pa gang brtsams pa de yang nyams so //
analyzed: @240b gzhan ni thog mar brtsams nas bzhag pa dang / 'bras bu'i dus can ni gzhag pa'i dus su gnyis pa gang brtsams pa de yang nyams so //
translated: The other is that which is first undertaken and then set aside.üîΩThat which is at the time of the result is that which, at the time of setting it aside, is the second that is undertaken.

original: de yang ni gang gnyis pa gtong ba de yang ma bsgrubs so //
analyzed: de yang ni gang gnyis pa gtong ba de yang ma bsgrubs so //
translated: And that which is not accomplished is that which is set aside, the second.

original: gang las nga rgyal zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gang las nga rgyal zhes bshad de /
translated: From what is pride explained?

original: gsum las so //
analyzed: gsum las so //
translated: From three.

original: de la las kyi nga rgyal bshad de /
analyzed: de la las kyi nga rgyal bshad de /
translated: Therein, the pride of action is explained.

original: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, I am the one who does it, and so on.

original: nyes pa med pa'i las sems can rnams la gang bya bar 'os pa /
analyzed: nyes pa med pa'i las sems can rnams la gang bya bar 'os pa /
translated: The action that is appropriate for sentient beings, which is without fault,

original: de bdag nyid gcig pus bya'i /
analyzed: de bdag nyid gcig pus bya'i /
translated: that is to be done by oneself alone.

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: Because of the afflictions, and so on, is easy to understand.

original: dman pa'i las ni mi gtsang ba 'dor ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: dman pa'i las ni mi gtsang ba 'dor ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: Inferior action is the removal of impurities, and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i nga rgyal bshad de /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i nga rgyal bshad de /
translated: The pride of the secondary afflictions is explained.

original: shi ba la sogs pa ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: shi ba la sogs pa ni dpe yin no //
translated: Death, and so on, are the examples.

original: gal te bdag gi yid brtson pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi yid brtson pa med par gyur na /
translated: If my mind becomes without effort,

original: de'i tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngus byas pa'i ltung ba yang gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngus byas pa'i ltung ba yang gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, even a downfall created by a minor secondary mental affliction will be harmful.

original: zhum pas rtsol ba dor zhing dga' ba med la gnod par 'byung ba sla'o //
analyzed: zhum pas rtsol ba dor zhing dga' ba med la gnod par 'byung ba sla'o //
translated: One who is slack will give up striving, will not be joyful, and will easily be harmed.

original: langs pa ni rtsol ba dang ldan zhing dran pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la skabs mi 'byed na /
analyzed: langs pa ni rtsol ba dang ldan zhing dran pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la skabs mi 'byed na /
translated: But one who is aroused, who is endowed with striving, and who does not give an opportunity to the secondary mental afflictions through mindfulness,

original: nyon mongs pa chen po yis kyang thub par dka'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chen po yis kyang thub par dka'o //
translated: will not be overcome even by a great mental affliction.

original: de bas brtan pas ni nga rgyal gyi go cha gyon pa ste /
analyzed: de bas brtan pas ni nga rgyal gyi go cha gyon pa ste /
translated: Therefore, one who is firm puts on the armor of self-confidence

original: ltung ba rnams 'jug tu mi ster ba des gzhom par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba rnams 'jug tu mi ster ba des gzhom par bya'o //
translated: and conquers with that, not allowing downfalls to enter.

original: gzhan du 'jig rten gsum gdul bar rtsom pa ni bzhad gad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du 'jig rten gsum gdul bar rtsom pa ni bzhad gad du 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, one who undertakes to tame the three worlds will be ridiculed,

original: bdag ltung bas pham par byas pas so //
analyzed: bdag ltung bas pham par byas pas so //
translated: because one will be defeated by downfalls.

original: de bas bdag gi nyon mongs pa la sogs pa thams cad pham par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas bdag gi nyon mongs pa la sogs pa thams cad pham par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will defeat all my mental afflictions and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir rgyal ba rnams kho na seng ge ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyal ba rnams kho na seng ge ste /
translated: For, only the victors are lions,

original: bdud kyi ri dags kyi gnod pas mi tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi ri dags kyi gnod pas mi tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not harmed by the deer-like demons.

original: de dag gi sras bdag yin pas gzhan gyis pham par ga la nus /
analyzed: de dag gi sras bdag yin pas gzhan gyis pham par ga la nus /
translated: Since I am the son of those who have conquered the world, how can I be defeated by others?

original: 'o na nga rgyal gyi nyon mongs pa yin pas de ji ltar blang bya yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nga rgyal gyi nyon mongs pa yin pas de ji ltar blang bya yin zhe na /
translated: But since pride is a mental affliction, how can it be something to be adopted?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa skye bo gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa skye bo gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who are proud, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nga rgyal can dgra bo'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal can dgra bo'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proud are not subject to the power of enemies.

original: de dag ni nga rgyal dgra'i dbang du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag ni nga rgyal dgra'i dbang du mi 'gyur /
translated: They are not subject to the power of the enemy, pride.

original: de bas nga rgyal 'dir dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas nga rgyal 'dir dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, pride is intended here.

original: tshigs bcad gnyis kyis 'jig rten gyi nga rgyal spang bar bshad de /
analyzed: tshigs bcad gnyis kyis 'jig rten gyi nga rgyal spang bar bshad de /
translated: Two verses explaining the abandonment of worldly pride.

original: ngan song ni dmyal ba ste /
analyzed: ngan song ni dmyal ba ste /
translated: The lower realms are the hells.

original: las zad pas de nas thar te mir skyes kyang gzhan gyi zas za'i bran zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: las zad pas de nas thar te mir skyes kyang gzhan gyi zas za'i bran zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: Having been liberated from there by the exhaustion of karma, even if one is born as a human, one is called a slave who eats the food of others, etc.

original: 'dod pa'i nga rgyal bshad de /üîΩgang zhig nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir /üîΩbrtson pa de kho nas nga rgyal @241a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nga rgyal bshad de / gang zhig nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir / brtson pa de kho nas nga rgyal @241a * //
translated: The pride of desire is explained.

original: can dang / rnam rgyal dang / dpa' bo yin no //
analyzed: can dang / rnam rgyal dang / dpa' bo yin no //
translated: He who strives to abandon pride is the one who is proud, the victor, the hero.

original: gang zhig kun du slong ba'i nga rgyal gyis dgra bo bsad nas /
analyzed: gang zhig kun du slong ba'i nga rgyal gyis dgra bo bsad nas /
translated: One who kills an enemy with the pride of complete self-confidenceüîΩand then gives his flesh to the world,

original: 'gro ba la 'dod pa bzhin du rgyal ba'i 'bras bu ni nga rgyal med pa nyid de /üîΩde rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba la 'dod pa bzhin du rgyal ba'i 'bras bu ni nga rgyal med pa nyid de / de rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: attains the fruit of victory, which is the absence of pride.

original: nus pa'i nga rgyal bshad de /
analyzed: nus pa'i nga rgyal bshad de /
translated: The pride of ability is explained.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi nang du gnas na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi nang du gnas na /
translated: When one remains in the midst of the mass of afflictions,

original: stong 'gyur du sran gzugs 'gyur bar 'tshal /
analyzed: stong 'gyur du sran gzugs 'gyur bar 'tshal /
translated: one should be like a lion,

original: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis mi tshugs par bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis mi tshugs par bya ste /
translated: unshakable by the mass of afflictions.üîΩJust as a powerful lion overwhelms all deer,

original: dper na seng ge gzi brjid che ba ri dags thams cad zil gyis gnon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na seng ge gzi brjid che ba ri dags thams cad zil gyis gnon pa bzhin no //
translated: so too should one be.

original: ji ltar mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro lce'i yul shin tu 'bad kyang mig gis mthong mi nus te /
analyzed: ji ltar mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro lce'i yul shin tu 'bad kyang mig gis mthong mi nus te /
translated: Just as a sweet taste and so on is an object of the tongue and cannot be seen by the eye,

original: de gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latter is the domain of form,

original: de bzhin du nyam nga ba yin kyang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyam nga ba yin kyang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, one should not come under the power of the afflictions, even in a terrifying situation.

original: blo ldan gyi las nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ldan gyi las nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind of the wise is the antidote to the afflictions.

original: nga rgyal gsum bshad nas dga' ba'i stobs bshad de /
analyzed: nga rgyal gsum bshad nas dga' ba'i stobs bshad de /
translated: Having explained the three types of pride, he explains the power of delight.

original: las gang skabs su bab pa bsam gtan nam thos pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: las gang skabs su bab pa bsam gtan nam thos pa la sogs pa /
translated: Whatever action is appropriate, such as meditation or listening,

original: de nyid du sems nub pa ltar de la 'dod pa bskyed de /
analyzed: de nyid du sems nub pa ltar de la 'dod pa bskyed de /
