translated: So it is difficult to please the ignoble.

original: gzhan yang phan par bslabs na khro bar byed de mi shes pas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang phan par bslabs na khro bar byed de mi shes pas so //
translated: Moreover, they get angry when you try to help them, because they do not understand.

original: slar bdag kyang phan pa las zlog par byed /
analyzed: slar bdag kyang phan pa las zlog par byed /
translated: They even turn you away from what is beneficial.

original: gal te phan pa ma yin pas de la mi nyan na /
analyzed: gal te phan pa ma yin pas de la mi nyan na /
translated: If you do not listen to them because they are not being helpful,

original: de'i tshe khros pas ngan song du 'gro ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe khros pas ngan song du 'gro ste /
translated: At that time, through anger, one goes to the miserable realms.

original: phan pa la sdang bas so //
analyzed: phan pa la sdang bas so //
translated: Because one hates the beneficial.

original: rang las rig pa dang rigs dang nor la sogs pa mthong na phrag dog byed /
analyzed: rang las rig pa dang rigs dang nor la sogs pa mthong na phrag dog byed /
translated: One is jealous of those who are seen to be equal or superior to oneself in terms of knowledge, family, wealth, and so on.

original: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa mi bzod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa mi bzod pas so //
translated: Because one cannot bear the excellence of others.

original: rang dang mnyam pa dang rtsod par byed do //
analyzed: rang dang mnyam pa dang rtsod par byed do //
translated: One competes with those who are equal to oneself.

original: rang las dman pa las nga rgyal byed /
analyzed: rang las dman pa las nga rgyal byed /
translated: One is proud of those who are inferior to oneself.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i yon tan gyis bstod @243a * //üîΩna khengs par byed /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i yon tan gyis bstod @243a * // na khengs par byed /
translated: One is elated by praise for existent and non-existent good qualities.

original: de'i skyon brjod pa thos nas khong khro /
analyzed: de'i skyon brjod pa thos nas khong khro /
translated: One is angry when one hears the expression of one's faults.

original: de bas byis pa la phan pa nam yang med do //
analyzed: de bas byis pa la phan pa nam yang med do //
translated: Therefore, the childish are never beneficial.

original: byis pa gcig las byis pa gzhan la nges par mi dge ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: byis pa gcig las byis pa gzhan la nges par mi dge ba 'byung ste /
translated: From one childish person, another childish person certainly gets only non-virtue.

original: thos pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bsngags pas rang la bstod pa dang / gzhan la thos pa la sogs pa sbed cing skyon brjod pas smod pa dang 'dod pa'i yon tan brjod pas 'khor bar dga' ba'i gtam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bsngags pas rang la bstod pa dang / gzhan la thos pa la sogs pa sbed cing skyon brjod pas smod pa dang 'dod pa'i yon tan brjod pas 'khor bar dga' ba'i gtam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Through praise in terms of learning and so on, one praises oneself; through concealing the learning and so on of others and expressing their faults, one disparages others; and through expressing the qualities of the sense objects, one engages in conversation that delights in cyclic existence.

original: de ltar gzhan la yang de gnyis dang tshogs pas mi dge ba gang rung nges par 'byung /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan la yang de gnyis dang tshogs pas mi dge ba gang rung nges par 'byung /
translated: In the same way, one should definitely avoid both of these and their combination.

original: rgyu mtshan des byis pa dang tshogs pa ni don ma yin pa dang tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan des byis pa dang tshogs pa ni don ma yin pa dang tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: For this reason, the childish and their company are not the point, and their company is not the point.

original: de bas byis pa'i tshogs dang bral ba gcig pu'i bde ba spyad par bya'o zhes lus kyi dben pa'o //
analyzed: de bas byis pa'i tshogs dang bral ba gcig pu'i bde ba spyad par bya'o zhes lus kyi dben pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one should enjoy the happiness of solitude, free from the company of the childish. This is physical seclusion.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i sems dang ldan pa ni sems kyi dben pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i sems dang ldan pa ni sems kyi dben pa'o //
translated: Having a mind free from afflictions is mental seclusion.

original: 'o na lus dang sems kyi dben pa thob pa rnams byis pa dang tshogs na ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na lus dang sems kyi dben pa thob pa rnams byis pa dang tshogs na ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: But how do those who have attained physical and mental seclusion act when they are with the childish and their company?

original: byis pa las ring du song nas byol te /
analyzed: byis pa las ring du song nas byol te /
translated: Having gone far away from the childish, they avoid them.

original: ji ltar de dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar de dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: How could they become connected with them?

original: gal te ma tshor bar slob na de'i tshe dga' ba'i spyod pas mgu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ma tshor bar slob na de'i tshe dga' ba'i spyod pas mgu bar bya'o //
translated: If they are not accepted, then they should please them with agreeable conduct.

original: 'dris pa'i ched du ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dris pa'i ched du ma yin te /
translated: It is not for the sake of familiarity.

original: 'on kyang rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba med cing mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba med cing mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba bzhin no //
translated: However, it is like being free from attachment and aversion, and not falling into the two extremes.

original: grong la rgyu na chos kyi don tsam chos gos dang bsod snyoms blangs te /
analyzed: grong la rgyu na chos kyi don tsam chos gos dang bsod snyoms blangs te /
translated: If you go to town, take only the necessities of the Dharma, the Dharma robes and alms.

original: bud ba me tog la sbrang rtsi len pa ltar /
analyzed: bud ba me tog la sbrang rtsi len pa ltar /
translated: Like a bee taking nectar from a flower,

original: kun la sngon chad ma mthong ba bzhin 'dris pa med par spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: kun la sngon chad ma mthong ba bzhin 'dris pa med par spyad par bya'o //
translated: you should act in such a way that you are not familiar with anything, as if you had never seen it before.

original: rnyed pa la sogs pa la chags pa spong bar bshad de /
analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa la chags pa spong bar bshad de /
translated: It is explained that you should abandon attachment to gain and so forth.

original: rnyed pa ni snam sbyar la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni snam sbyar la sogs pa'o //
translated: Gain is robes and so forth.

original: bkur sti ni skye bo rnams kyis byas pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti ni skye bo rnams kyis byas pa'o //
translated: Honor is being revered by people.

original: mi mang po zhig gis bkur bar zhus nas /
analyzed: mi mang po zhig gis bkur bar zhus nas /
translated: If you are asked to be honored by many people,

original: cig car byung ba'i 'chi ba las 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: cig car byung ba'i 'chi ba las 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: you will fear death, which comes suddenly.

original: de ni 'di ltar spyad na mi 'byung bar bshad de /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar spyad na mi 'byung bar bshad de /
translated: It is explained that this will not happen if you act in the following way:

original: yid bde bar rgyal ba gang dang gang du chags par 'gyur ba de dang der /
analyzed: yid bde bar rgyal ba gang dang gang du chags par 'gyur ba de dang der /
translated: Wherever the Victorious One is attached,

original: sdug bsngal nyid stong 'gyur du yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid stong 'gyur du yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: there suffering will ripen a thousandfold.

original: de bas mkhas pas rnyed pa la sogs pa la chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas mkhas pas rnyed pa la sogs pa la chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise do not become attached to gain and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa las 'jigs pa skye'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa las 'jigs pa skye'o //
translated: Because fear arises from desire.

original: gzhan yang rnyed pa la sogs pa 'di dag mi rtag pa yin par rang gi ngang gis nyams te /üîΩbstan pa brtag par @243b bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnyed pa la sogs pa 'di dag mi rtag pa yin par rang gi ngang gis nyams te / bstan pa brtag par @243b bya'o //
translated: They will decline.

original: nyams pa'i rang bzhin la zhen pas ci ste /
analyzed: nyams pa'i rang bzhin la zhen pas ci ste /
translated: What is the point of clinging to a nature that will decline?

original: 'di ltar sngon du rnyed pa dang grags pa can mang du byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon du rnyed pa dang grags pa can mang du byung ste /
translated: In this way, many in the past have had gains and fame.

original: byung kyang nyams pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rnyed pa dang grags pa dang bcas pa gar song mi shes so //
analyzed: byung kyang nyams pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rnyed pa dang grags pa dang bcas pa gar song mi shes so //
translated: But because they had a nature that declined, no one knows what became of their gains and fame.

original: de rnyed pa dang de ma yin pa /
analyzed: de rnyed pa dang de ma yin pa /
translated: He explains that one should not cling to gains and not cling to their absence,

original: grags pa dang de ma yin pa /
analyzed: grags pa dang de ma yin pa /
translated: to fame and not to its absence,

original: bde ba dang sdug pa bstod pa dang smad pa la mi zhen par bshad de /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug pa bstod pa dang smad pa la mi zhen par bshad de /
translated: to pleasure and not to pain, to praise and to blame.

original: bstod pa byas pas bdag ci ste dga'/
analyzed: bstod pa byas pas bdag ci ste dga'/
translated: Why be pleased when praised?

original: gang gi phyir bdag la gzhan smod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag la gzhan smod pa'o //
translated: Because others blame me.

original: bdag la smod pas ci ste mi dga'/
analyzed: bdag la smod pas ci ste mi dga'/
translated: Why be displeased when blamed?

original: gang gi phyir bdag la gzhan gyis bstod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag la gzhan gyis bstod pa'o //
translated: Because others praise me.

original: smad pa mi byed pa'i phyir 'di dag mgu bar byed pa mi nus par bshad de /
analyzed: smad pa mi byed pa'i phyir 'di dag mgu bar byed pa mi nus par bshad de /
translated: He explains that one cannot please them because they do not do what should be done.

original: sems can mos pa rnam pa sna tshogs pas rgyal bas kyang mgu bar mi nus na /
analyzed: sems can mos pa rnam pa sna tshogs pas rgyal bas kyang mgu bar mi nus na /
translated: The Victorious Ones themselves cannot please beings, whose inclinations are so various.

original: bdag mi shes pas lta ci dgos /
analyzed: bdag mi shes pas lta ci dgos /
translated: What need to speak of someone ignorant like me?

original: de bas 'jig rten bsam pa btang ngo //
analyzed: de bas 'jig rten bsam pa btang ngo //
translated: Therefore, I will give up thinking about the world.

original: gzhan yang rnyed pa med pa la bsod nams ma bsags pa zhes smod /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnyed pa med pa la bsod nams ma bsags pa zhes smod /
translated: Moreover, they disparage those who have no possessions, calling them ‚Äúunfortunate.‚Äù

original: rnyed pa can la spyod log gis gzhan gyi mgo bskor nas rnyed do zhes 'phya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa can la spyod log gis gzhan gyi mgo bskor nas rnyed do zhes 'phya'o //
translated: They slander those who have possessions, saying, ‚ÄúThey deceive others with their false piety and so have acquired their wealth.‚Äù

original: gzhan du na gzhan la yon tan med dam /
analyzed: gzhan du na gzhan la yon tan med dam /
translated: ‚ÄúDo they have no good qualities?

original: kho gcig pus rnyed pa ci /
analyzed: kho gcig pus rnyed pa ci /
translated: How did they get their possessions all by themselves?

original: rang bzhin gyis 'grogs par dka' ba de dag dang ji ltar dga' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'grogs par dka' ba de dag dang ji ltar dga' bar 'gyur /
translated: They are naturally difficult to be with. How could I enjoy being with them?‚Äù

original: byis pa su dang yang mdza' bar mi 'gyur zhes sangs rgyas kyis gsungs /
analyzed: byis pa su dang yang mdza' bar mi 'gyur zhes sangs rgyas kyis gsungs /
translated: The Buddha has said, ‚ÄúNo one should be a friend of fools.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir kho rang gi don ma grub na dga' bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho rang gi don ma grub na dga' bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not happy unless they are achieving their own goals.

original: rang gi don gyi sgo nas dga' ba gang yin pa de ni mdza' bo dang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi sgo nas dga' ba gang yin pa de ni mdza' bo dang ma yin gyi /
translated: Those who are happy because of their own goals are not friends.

original: ji ltar rang don kho na'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar rang don kho na'i phyir te /
translated: How could they be?

original: nor brlag nas gang mi dga' ba de nor gyi thog tu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nor brlag nas gang mi dga' ba de nor gyi thog tu ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the loss of wealth that makes people unhappy,

original: 'on kyang rang gi bde ba nyams pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi bde ba nyams pas so //
translated: but the loss of their own happiness.

original: lus la sogs pa'i dben pa'i phyir nags la sogs pa dben pa'i gnas bshad de /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i dben pa'i phyir nags la sogs pa dben pa'i gnas bshad de /
translated: The forest, etc., are explained as solitary places because of the solitude of the body, etc.

original: ljon shing la sogs pa ni smod pa mi byed la /
analyzed: ljon shing la sogs pa ni smod pa mi byed la /
translated: The trees, etc., do not criticize.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i spyod pas 'bad de mgu bar byed kyang mi dgos pas /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i spyod pas 'bad de mgu bar byed kyang mi dgos pas /
translated: Even though one tries to please them with conduct that accords with them, they do not need it.

original: bsam pa mi mthun pa dang bral ba 'grogs bde ba dang lhan cig tu gnas pa na ma 'byung zhes smon pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa mi mthun pa dang bral ba 'grogs bde ba dang lhan cig tu gnas pa na ma 'byung zhes smon pa'o //
translated: So, when one lives with those who are easy to be with, who are free from contrary ideas, one should wish that they not arise.

original: mi med pa'i lha khang ngam /
analyzed: mi med pa'i lha khang ngam /
translated: In a temple without people,

original: shing drung ngam /
analyzed: shing drung ngam /
translated: under a tree,

original: dgon par dus 'dod pa bzhin bsdad la nam ltos pa med par chags pa'i gnas med par rgyab tu mi lta bar 'gyur zhig gu /
analyzed: dgon par dus 'dod pa bzhin bsdad la nam ltos pa med par chags pa'i gnas med par rgyab tu mi lta bar 'gyur zhig gu /
translated: in a secluded place, one should stay as long as one likes, without regard for time. One should go without looking back, to a place where one is not attached.

original: ri'am nags kyi phyogs sus kyang bdag gir ma byas pa ched du ma byas pas rang @244a * //
analyzed: ri'am nags kyi phyogs sus kyang bdag gir ma byas pa ched du ma byas pas rang @244a * //
translated: In a forest or on a mountain, a place not owned by anyone, not cultivated,

original: bzhin gyis yangs pa /
analyzed: bzhin gyis yangs pa /
translated: naturally spacious,

original: stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang rjes su mthun par rang gi dbang gis byang chub la spyod cing dmigs pa med par nam gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang rjes su mthun par rang gi dbang gis byang chub la spyod cing dmigs pa med par nam gnas par 'gyur /
translated: When will one dwell without objectifying, practicing enlightenment by one's own power in accordance with the cultivation of emptiness?

original: rdza'i lhung bzed tsam gyi nor can /
analyzed: rdza'i lhung bzed tsam gyi nor can /
translated: One has wealth the size of an earthenware begging bowl.

original: phyag dar khrod pa yin pas chom rkun mi 'dod pa'i gos can /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa yin pas chom rkun mi 'dod pa'i gos can /
translated: One is a refuse-rag wearer, having robes unwanted by thieves.

original: de bas 'jigs pa med par zhen pa med pas lus mi srung zhing nam gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas 'jigs pa med par zhen pa med pas lus mi srung zhing nam gnas par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, when will one dwell without fear, without attachment, not protecting the body?

original: 'dis kyang phyi nang la zhen pa med par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis kyang phyi nang la zhen pa med par bshad do //
translated: This also explains the absence of attachment to the internal and the external.

original: tshigs bcad gsum gyis dur khrod la spyod pa sman par bshad de /
analyzed: tshigs bcad gsum gyis dur khrod la spyod pa sman par bshad de /
translated: Three verses on the practice of the charnel ground, which is the medicine:

original: rang gi lus kyi gnas dur khrod du song la sngar shi ba rnams kyi keng rus dang / rang gi lus 'jig pa'i chos can du mgo snyoms par nam byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi lus kyi gnas dur khrod du song la sngar shi ba rnams kyi keng rus dang / rang gi lus 'jig pa'i chos can du mgo snyoms par nam byed par 'gyur /
translated: Having gone to the charnel ground, the place of one's own body, when will one make equal the skeleton of the dead and one's own body, which is subject to destruction?

original: de nyid bshad de /
analyzed: de nyid bshad de /
translated: This is explained:

original: bdag gi lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: One's own body is also like that, and so on, is easy to understand.

original: bdag tu 'khrul pa'i gnas /
analyzed: bdag tu 'khrul pa'i gnas /
translated: The basis of the error of self.

original: 'khrul pas gcig pur brtags pa /
analyzed: 'khrul pas gcig pur brtags pa /
translated: The error of imagining it to be unitary.

original: rdul phra rab kyi phung po'i lus dang lhan cig tu skyes pa /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi phung po'i lus dang lhan cig tu skyes pa /
translated: And when the aggregates of subtle particles of the body are born together with the body,

original: nus pa'i dum bu rnams kyang zhig ste so sor gyur na /
analyzed: nus pa'i dum bu rnams kyang zhig ste so sor gyur na /
translated: the parts of the potential are destroyed and become separate.

original: mdza' ba gzhan rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: mdza' ba gzhan rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention other friends?

original: de bas skyes na'ang 'chi na'ang gcig pu yin pas /
analyzed: de bas skyes na'ang 'chi na'ang gcig pu yin pas /
translated: Therefore, when born and when dying, you are alone.

original: de'i sdug bsngal gyi cha bu la sogs pas mi len pas /
analyzed: de'i sdug bsngal gyi cha bu la sogs pas mi len pas /
translated: Since your children and so forth do not take on a portion of your suffering,

original: dge ba'i bar chad de dag gis ci bya /
analyzed: dge ba'i bar chad de dag gis ci bya /
translated: what use are these obstacles to virtue?

original: lam du zhugs pas nub mo sdod pa'i phyir gnas 'dzin pa ltar ris drug tu 'khor bas skye ba len pa ste /
analyzed: lam du zhugs pas nub mo sdod pa'i phyir gnas 'dzin pa ltar ris drug tu 'khor bas skye ba len pa ste /
translated: Just as you take up a place to stay for the night when you are traveling, you take up birth because of the cycle of the six kinds of beings.

original: yun rings mi gnas pas de la chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yun rings mi gnas pas de la chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Since you do not stay long, do not be attached to it.

original: tshigs bcad gsum gyis gcig pur gnas pa'i yon tan bshad de /
analyzed: tshigs bcad gsum gyis gcig pur gnas pa'i yon tan bshad de /
translated: Three verses explain the good qualities of living alone.

original: khang pa 'dor mi nus kyang phyis btsan thabs su 'dor dgos par shes nas /
analyzed: khang pa 'dor mi nus kyang phyis btsan thabs su 'dor dgos par shes nas /
translated: Even if you cannot abandon your house, you should know that later you will have to forcefully abandon it.üîΩWhen you die, four men will carry you out of that house

original: 'chi na khyim de las mi bzhis ji srid phyi rol du ma bton gyi bar du /
analyzed: 'chi na khyim de las mi bzhis ji srid phyi rol du ma bton gyi bar du /
translated: and put you in the charnel ground.

original: bu kyi hud ces bya ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pas mya ngan ma byas kyi bar du nags su 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: bu kyi hud ces bya ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pas mya ngan ma byas kyi bar du nags su 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: The son, alas, will not go to the forest until the world has ceased to grieve.

original: lus 'di la bstod kyang dga' ba med /
analyzed: lus 'di la bstod kyang dga' ba med /
translated: This body does not rejoice in praise,

original: mi mthun pa la yang khong khro ba med /üîΩgnyi ga la nyams te bems po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa la yang khong khro ba med / gnyi ga la nyams te bems po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: nor does it get angry at criticism.üîΩBoth are lost, because it is inanimate.

original: de gnyis med pas sngon du skye ba'i dus kho nar 'chi ste /
analyzed: de gnyis med pas sngon du skye ba'i dus kho nar 'chi ste /
translated: Since both are absent, it dies at the very time of its birth,

original: sems pa med pas mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems pa med pas mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is similar to what is without thought.

original: 'chi ba'i tshe na'ang 'jig rten gyi mya ngan gyis mya ngan mi byed de /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i tshe na'ang 'jig rten gyi mya ngan gyis mya ngan mi byed de /
translated: At the time of death, it does not grieve with worldly grief,

original: bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnye bar gyur pa'i nye du rnams de dang bral ba'i gdung bas nags su gnas pa'i yid la gnod pa @244b mi byed de /
analyzed: bems po yin pa'i phyir ro // nye bar gyur pa'i nye du rnams de dang bral ba'i gdung bas nags su gnas pa'i yid la gnod pa @244b mi byed de /
translated: because it is inanimate.

original: drung na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drung na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The grief of relatives who are close to it does not trouble the mind of one who lives in the forest, because they are not present.üîΩThere is no distraction to the mindfulness of the Buddha, etc.,

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras de kho na nyid dmigs pa la sogs pa la g-yeng bar byed pa 'ang med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras de kho na nyid dmigs pa la sogs pa la g-yeng bar byed pa 'ang med do //
translated: and to the apprehension of reality, etc.

original: de bas bu la sogs pa gso mi dgos pas tshogs chung ba nges par legs par skyer rung ba /
analyzed: de bas bu la sogs pa gso mi dgos pas tshogs chung ba nges par legs par skyer rung ba /
translated: Therefore, since it is not necessary to support a son, etc.,

original: g-yeng ba thams cad zhe ba nyams dga' bar rtag tu gcig pur gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yeng ba thams cad zhe ba nyams dga' bar rtag tu gcig pur gnas par bya'o //

translated: They are blue,

original: rul pa la sogs pa mi sdug pa 'jigs su rung ba gzhan yang ltos shig / rang bzhin gyis ma rungs pas pags pa bshus pa'i lus la 'jigs pa chen po skye ste /
analyzed: rul pa la sogs pa mi sdug pa 'jigs su rung ba gzhan yang ltos shig / rang bzhin gyis ma rungs pas pags pa bshus pa'i lus la 'jigs pa chen po skye ste /
translated: putrid, and so forth. They are ugly and terrifying.

original: de ltar shes kyang de la dga' ba ji ltar skye /
analyzed: de ltar shes kyang de la dga' ba ji ltar skye /
translated: Even though you know this, how can you take pleasure in them?

original: 'o na tsandan bskus na yid du 'ong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tsandan bskus na yid du 'ong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if you anoint them with sandalwood, they become attractive.

original: smras pa / dri 'di lus la bskus kyang tsandan kho na las yin gyi lus las ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / dri 'di lus la bskus kyang tsandan kho na las yin gyi lus las ma yin no //
translated: We reply: Even if you anoint the body with this perfume, it is only the sandalwood that smells good, not the body.

original: de bas gzhan gyi dris gzhan la chags pa ci /
analyzed: de bas gzhan gyi dris gzhan la chags pa ci /
translated: So why be attached to something that is only a source of smell for others?

original: gal te rang bzhin gyi dri nga bas 'dir bud med kyi gzugs la chags pa mi skye na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyi dri nga bas 'dir bud med kyi gzugs la chags pa mi skye na /
translated: If you are not attached to the body of a woman because of its natural bad smell,

original: legs min nam /
analyzed: legs min nam /
translated: is that not better?

original: de ltar yon tan yod kyang 'jig rten don med srid pa ci /
analyzed: de ltar yon tan yod kyang 'jig rten don med srid pa ci /
translated: But if you are attached to it in spite of its bad smell, what is the point of this meaningless existence in the world?

original: lus de la gla rtsi la sogs pa'i dri byugs so //
analyzed: lus de la gla rtsi la sogs pa'i dri byugs so //
translated: The body is smeared with perfumes such as musk.

original: byug pa byas kyang gtsang du mi 'gro bar bshad de /
analyzed: byug pa byas kyang gtsang du mi 'gro bar bshad de /
translated: Even though it is smeared, it does not become clean.

original: lus rang bzhin gyis dri nga ba la tsandan dri zhim pas khyad par ci byung /
analyzed: lus rang bzhin gyis dri nga ba la tsandan dri zhim pas khyad par ci byung /
translated: What difference does it make to a body that is naturally malodorous to smear it with the sweet scent of sandalwood?

original: dri'i stobs kyis de yid du 'ong bar byung zhe na /
analyzed: dri'i stobs kyis de yid du 'ong bar byung zhe na /
translated: If you think that the body becomes attractive through the power of scent,

original: gzhan dris gzhan la chags pa ci //
analyzed: gzhan dris gzhan la chags pa ci //
translated: why be attached to something that smells of something else?

original: skra la sogs pa la 'dus byas pa yang don ma yin par @246b tshigs bcad gnyis kyis bshad de /
analyzed: skra la sogs pa la 'dus byas pa yang don ma yin par @246b tshigs bcad gnyis kyis bshad de /
translated: Two verses explaining that it is pointless to adorn the body with hair and so on.

original: gal te ma bcad pas skra dang sen mo ring ba dang / ma bkrus pas dri ma chags pas dri ma'i 'dam dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gal te ma bcad pas skra dang sen mo ring ba dang / ma bkrus pas dri ma chags pas dri ma'i 'dam dang ldan pa /
translated: If you do not cut your hair and nails, they grow long. If you do not wash, you become soiled and covered with dirt.

original: gos med pas gcer bu yi dags kyi bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'jigs su rung ba'i lus /üîΩrang gsod pa'i phyir mtshon la bzhin du /
analyzed: gos med pas gcer bu yi dags kyi bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'jigs su rung ba'i lus / rang gsod pa'i phyir mtshon la bzhin du /
translated: If you do not wear clothes, you are naked, and your body is naturally frightening, like a hungry ghost.

original: ci ste de la 'bad de byi dor byed /
analyzed: ci ste de la 'bad de byi dor byed /
translated: Why would you exert yourself in adorning it, as if it were a weapon that kills you?

original: bdag nyid shes bzhin du rmongs par byed pa la brtson pa smyon pa rnams kyis kyi hud sa gzhi ni dkrugs so //
analyzed: bdag nyid shes bzhin du rmongs par byed pa la brtson pa smyon pa rnams kyis kyi hud sa gzhi ni dkrugs so //
translated: Alas, the earth is polluted by those who, while knowing the truth, strive to deceive.

original: 'phral la byung ba bshad nas gnas skabs bshad de /
analyzed: 'phral la byung ba bshad nas gnas skabs bshad de /
translated: Having explained the present, he explains the future:

original: rus gong 'ba' zhig dur khrod du mthong nas khyed la yid byung skyes na ;
analyzed: rus gong 'ba' zhig dur khrod du mthong nas khyed la yid byung skyes na ;
translated: When you see a skeleton in a charnel ground, you are disgusted.

original: grong khyer nyid dur khrod de mtshan mo gnyid du song nas rang bzhin gyis dbye ba med par sems can la 'dir dbugs rgyu bas khyad par du g-yo ba'i rus gong gis khyab pa la ci ste dga'/
analyzed: grong khyer nyid dur khrod de mtshan mo gnyid du song nas rang bzhin gyis dbye ba med par sems can la 'dir dbugs rgyu bas khyad par du g-yo ba'i rus gong gis khyab pa la ci ste dga'/
translated: But in a city, at night, when you fall asleep, the charnel ground is not different from the city, and the skeleton is not different from the living being. It is covered with skin and filled with intestines. Why do you like it?

original: des na lus bems po yin pas g-yo ba kho na khyad par yin par bshad do //
analyzed: des na lus bems po yin pas g-yo ba kho na khyad par yin par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the body is an inert object. Movement alone is the difference.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rigs pas /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rigs pas /
translated: By the reasoning explained in this way,

original: bud med kyi lus mi gtsang ba yin kyang /
analyzed: bud med kyi lus mi gtsang ba yin kyang /
translated: the body of a woman is impure.

original: rin med na mi rnyed rin gyi ched du nor tshol ba la sha thang ba'i du: kha dang / gzhan gyi bud med blangs pas dmyal ba la sogs par gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: rin med na mi rnyed rin gyi ched du nor tshol ba la sha thang ba'i du: kha dang / gzhan gyi bud med blangs pas dmyal ba la sogs par gnod par 'gyur /
translated: By taking another's wife, one will suffer in hell and so on.

original: nor spel ba'i nus pa yang byis pa'i dus su med /
analyzed: nor spel ba'i nus pa yang byis pa'i dus su med /
translated: In childhood, one has no ability to increase wealth.

original: de ma byas na dar la bab na cis bde bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ma byas na dar la bab na cis bde bar 'gyur /
translated: If one does not do it then, how will one be happy when one is grown up?

original: der nor spel na tshe gtugs par 'gyur /
analyzed: der nor spel na tshe gtugs par 'gyur /
translated: If one does it then, one's life will be used up.

original: gang pha dang mes pos spel ba'i nor gyis dar la bab pa'i dus su bde ba de yang nyung ste /
analyzed: gang pha dang mes pos spel ba'i nor gyis dar la bab pa'i dus su bde ba de yang nyung ste /
translated: And even if one is happy when grown up with the wealth increased by one's father and grandfather, that is little.

original: skal ba dang mi ldan pa thams cad nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba dang mi ldan pa thams cad nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all who are not fortunate will lose it.

original: rin med par mi rnyed pa dang / dmyal ba la sogs par sdug bsngal ba 'di ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: rin med par mi rnyed pa dang / dmyal ba la sogs par sdug bsngal ba 'di ni mtshungs so //
translated: And it is the same whether one gets it free or not, and whether one suffers in hell and so on.

original: tshe rgas pa la sogs pa la longs spyod pa'i nus pa med do //
analyzed: tshe rgas pa la sogs pa la longs spyod pa'i nus pa med do //
translated: When one is old and so on, one has no ability to enjoy wealth.

original: nor spel ba la yang bde ba yod ce na /
analyzed: nor spel ba la yang bde ba yod ce na /
translated: If one says that there is happiness in increasing wealth,

original: smras pa / smad pa 'ga' zhig shing dang rtsva la sogs pa khur 'ongs pas lus dang yid ngal te /
analyzed: smras pa / smad pa 'ga' zhig shing dang rtsva la sogs pa khur 'ongs pas lus dang yid ngal te /
translated: Some, having brought back a load of wood, grass, and so forth, are exhausted in body and mind.

original: nyi ma nub pa nas khyim du 'ongs nas ;
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa nas khyim du 'ongs nas ;
translated: From sunset until they come home,

original: zhag re re zhing shi ba ltar nyal te /
analyzed: zhag re re zhing shi ba ltar nyal te /
translated: they sleep as if they were dead.

original: de la bde ba ga la yod /
analyzed: de la bde ba ga la yod /
translated: How can they have happiness?

original: rgyal po'i pho nya 'ga' zhig yul gzhan du ring du 'gro bas sha thang gi sdug pa /
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho nya 'ga' zhig yul gzhan du ring du 'gro bas sha thang gi sdug pa /
translated: Some royal messengers go far away to other countries and suffer from exhaustion.

original: lo du mar yang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa mi mthong ste /
analyzed: lo du mar yang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa mi mthong ste /
translated: For many years they do not see their children, wives, and so forth.

original: bu smad kyi don du rgyal po bsten kyang ngo //
analyzed: bu smad kyi don du rgyal po bsten kyang ngo //
translated: They serve the king for the sake of their children and wives.

original: mya ngan byed cing de nyid @247a * //
analyzed: mya ngan byed cing de nyid @247a * //
translated: They are miserable and die in a foreign land.üîΩIt is explained:

original: bshad de / bde ba'i don du bdag gzhan gyi bran du byas kyang 'dod pas rmongs pa dag gis bde ba de ma thob don med gzhan gyis bya bas tshe zad par byas dge ba la ma sbyar ba smod /
analyzed: bshad de / bde ba'i don du bdag gzhan gyi bran du byas kyang 'dod pas rmongs pa dag gis bde ba de ma thob don med gzhan gyis bya bas tshe zad par byas dge ba la ma sbyar ba smod /
translated: Though they are servants for the sake of happiness, those confused by desire do not obtain that happiness. They waste their lives doing meaningless things for others. They are despised for not applying themselves to virtue.

original: bde ba 'dod pas bdag gzhan dbang du byas pa 'ga' zhig gzhan gyi don du chung ma dang bcas par 'gro ba la lam du nags la sogs par chung ma bu btsas te /
analyzed: bde ba 'dod pas bdag gzhan dbang du byas pa 'ga' zhig gzhan gyi don du chung ma dang bcas par 'gro ba la lam du nags la sogs par chung ma bu btsas te /
translated: Some, because of desire for pleasure, make themselves and others subject to others. They go with their wives to other places. On the road, in the forest, etc., their wives give birth.

original: de'i tshe bde ba ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe bde ba ga la yod /
translated: At that time, where is their pleasure?

original: sbrum ma 'am byis pa khur ba dang lhan cig tu 'gro ba la rtag tu sdug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sbrum ma 'am byis pa khur ba dang lhan cig tu 'gro ba la rtag tu sdug pa kho na'o //
translated: Those who go with pregnant women or with infants always have only suffering.

original: 'khrul pa kho na bshad de /
analyzed: 'khrul pa kho na bshad de /
translated: Only error is explained.

original: 'ga' zhig gson pa'i don du /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gson pa'i don du /
translated: For the sake of some life,

original: gson pa the tshom za ba'i g-yul du 'jug / gzhan ni stobs ldan gang rung gis gnod pas de bzlog pa'i phyir sor mo bcad pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas gzhan gyi bran du khas len te /
analyzed: gson pa the tshom za ba'i g-yul du 'jug / gzhan ni stobs ldan gang rung gis gnod pas de bzlog pa'i phyir sor mo bcad pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas gzhan gyi bran du khas len te /
translated: they enter into battle, where life is doubtful. Others, because of being harmed by some powerful person, accept slavery to him, having first cut off their fingers, etc., in order to ward him off.

original: len pa 'don pas dkrugs pa'o //
analyzed: len pa 'don pas dkrugs pa'o //
translated: They are agitated by the noise of the taking of wages.

original: 'di nyid du sdug bsngal bshad de /
analyzed: 'di nyid du sdug bsngal bshad de /
translated: Suffering in this very life is explained:

original: 'dod ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: 'dod ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
translated: ‚ÄúThe desirous one, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi bud med dam nor 'phrog pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med dam nor 'phrog pa la sogs pas so //
translated: By taking away another‚Äôs wife or wealth, etc.

original: lhag ma go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: nor spel bas kyang sdug bsngal bar byed ces bshad de /
analyzed: nor spel bas kyang sdug bsngal bar byed ces bshad de /
translated: Wealth is a source of suffering, even when it is increased.üîΩ When it is increased, it is a source of suffering, because it is generated from what is nonexistent.

original: spel ba ni med pa bskyed pas kyang sdug bsngal bsags pa yang chu 'am me la sogs pa las srung bar dka'/
analyzed: spel ba ni med pa bskyed pas kyang sdug bsngal bsags pa yang chu 'am me la sogs pa las srung bar dka'/
translated: It is difficult to protect wealth from water, fire, and so on.

original: de bzhin du bsrung ba chom rkun la sogs pas nyams sgyid lug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsrung ba chom rkun la sogs pas nyams sgyid lug pa'o //
translated: Likewise, it is difficult to protect it from thieves and so on.üîΩ For these reasons, consider wealth to be a source of endless misfortune.

original: rgyu mtshan de dag gis nor ni phung khrol mtha' yas par rtog cig / rtag tu spel ba ga la g-yeng bas nor la chags pa'i blo ldan rnams skye ba la sogs pa'i du: kha las dgrol ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi skabs med do //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de dag gis nor ni phung khrol mtha' yas par rtog cig / rtag tu spel ba ga la g-yeng bas nor la chags pa'i blo ldan rnams skye ba la sogs pa'i du: kha las dgrol ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi skabs med do //
translated: Those who are attached to wealth, thinking, How can I increase it? are not free from the dangers of birth and so on, because they have no opportunity for meditative concentration.

original: nye bar bsdus shing bshad de /
analyzed: nye bar bsdus shing bshad de /
translated: This is the summary and explanation.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pa can la nyes dmigs sna tshogs pa 'khrul bas gang bde ba de yang shin tu lci ba'i khur khur zhing glang chen 'gro ba la g-yas g-yon du ltogs pas rtsa za ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pa can la nyes dmigs sna tshogs pa 'khrul bas gang bde ba de yang shin tu lci ba'i khur khur zhing glang chen 'gro ba la g-yas g-yon du ltogs pas rtsa za ba lta bu'o //
translated: Those who are confused about the various disadvantages of wealth, which are explained in this way, carry a very heavy burden, like an elephant that eats grass while wandering around to the right and left.üîΩ üîΩThe wise do not take up wealth, which is like a dream.

original: bde ba mnog chung phyugs kyis bsgrub na'ang bla ba'i don du las kyis mnar bas sngar bshad pa'i dal 'byor rnyed par dka' ba 'joms so //
analyzed: bde ba mnog chung phyugs kyis bsgrub na'ang bla ba'i don du las kyis mnar bas sngar bshad pa'i dal 'byor rnyed par dka' ba 'joms so //
translated: Even though cattle achieve a small amount of happiness, they are tormented by karma for the sake of their master. Therefore, they destroy the difficult-to-find freedoms and endowments explained above.

original: gnyis kyi mya ngan bshad de /
analyzed: gnyis kyi mya ngan bshad de /
translated: The second, the explanation of the suffering of grief, is as follows.

original: mi rtag pas cis kyang 'jig pa bems po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don mi nus pas chung ba de'i don du mi dge ba spyad pas /
analyzed: mi rtag pas cis kyang 'jig pa bems po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don mi nus pas chung ba de'i don du mi dge ba spyad pas /
translated: Since the body is impermanent, it will be destroyed by anything. Since it is inanimate, it is unable to accomplish the supramundane goal. For the sake of that small goal, one engages in nonvirtue.

original: dmyal ba la sogs par lhung bar byed pa'i lus kyi don du gso @247b ba'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas gang byas pa'i dub pa de'i bye ba brgya'i cha tsam gyis sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs par lhung bar byed pa'i lus kyi don du gso @247b ba'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas gang byas pa'i dub pa de'i bye ba brgya'i cha tsam gyis sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: For the sake of the body that causes one to fall into the hells and so on, one engages in the activities of nursing. For the sake of that, one will attain buddhahood in a fraction of the fatigue that has been created since beginningless cyclic existence.

original: 'o na byang chub kyi spyod pa la yang sdug bsngal mtha' yas pa yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub kyi spyod pa la yang sdug bsngal mtha' yas pa yod ce na /
translated: Well, if that is so, then there is also an infinite amount of suffering in the deeds of a bodhisattva.

original: smras pa / spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la ltos nas 'dod pa can gyi sdug bsngal che ste /
analyzed: smras pa / spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la ltos nas 'dod pa can gyi sdug bsngal che ste /
translated: It is said that compared to the suffering of deeds, the suffering of the desirous is great.

original: mi 'dod kyang rnam pa du ma 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi 'dod kyang rnam pa du ma 'byung ngo //
translated: Even though it is not desired, it arises in many ways.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod bzhin du dus nges pa can gzhan don du sdug bsngal myong ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod bzhin du dus nges pa can gzhan don du sdug bsngal myong ba la /
translated: Bodhisattvas experience suffering for the sake of others at a definite time, as they wish.

original: gang byang chub 'byung ba 'dod pa can la da med do //
analyzed: gang byang chub 'byung ba 'dod pa can la da med do //
translated: But for those who desire the occurrence of enlightenment, there is no such suffering.

original: sdug bsngal kho na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kho na 'byung ngo //
translated: Only suffering occurs.

original: 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa /
translated: The ripening of desire is the harm of the hells and so on.

original: lung las thos pa dran pa'i mtshon la sogs pa'i gnod pa yongs su grags pa dper mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung las thos pa dran pa'i mtshon la sogs pa'i gnod pa yongs su grags pa dper mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The harm of the weapons of memory and so on that are heard in the scriptures are well known and are not examples.

original: mtshon la sogs pas lan cig 'chi la 'dod pas skye ba mang por sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mtshon la sogs pas lan cig 'chi la 'dod pas skye ba mang por sdug bsngal lo //
translated: By weapons and so on, one dies once, but by desire, one suffers for many lives.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rigs pas 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga la skyo ba bskyed de /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rigs pas 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga la skyo ba bskyed de /
translated: Thus, through the reasoning explained, one should generate disgust for the five types of desirable qualities.

original: spyod yul ji srid pa brtags pa yang de srid de la dmigs pa'i rtog pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: spyod yul ji srid pa brtags pa yang de srid de la dmigs pa'i rtog pa 'byung ste /
translated: As long as one examines the domain, one generates concepts that focus on it.üîΩIt is said that only a mind with an object arises, not a mind without an object.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na sems pa skye'i dmigs pa med pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i rnam rtog kun gyis dben pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na sems pa skye'i dmigs pa med pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i rnam rtog kun gyis dben pa /
translated: It is free from all concepts.

original: dmigs pa kun gyis stong pa la dga' ba brtan pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa kun gyis stong pa la dga' ba brtan pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should generate a firm delight in the emptiness of all objects.

original: gar gnas she na /
analyzed: gar gnas she na /
translated: Where does one stand?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas rtsod pa dang ngal ba med pa skye bo med pas dben pa /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas rtsod pa dang ngal ba med pa skye bo med pas dben pa /
translated: In a forest that is peaceful, free from strife and fatigue, because there is no adverse side, and free from people, because it is secluded.

original: gnod sbyin dang / stag dang / sbrul dang / chom rkun la sogs pa med pas zhi ba'i nags kyi nang du'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang / stag dang / sbrul dang / chom rkun la sogs pa med pas zhi ba'i nags kyi nang du'o //
translated: In the interior of a forest that is peaceful, free from yakshas, tigers, snakes, robbers, etc.

original: bsam gtan gyi phan yon bshad de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi phan yon bshad de /
translated: The benefits of meditative concentration are explained.

original: skal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The fortunate one, etc.

original: bsam gtan ni gsum ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of meditative concentration:

original: de ltar brtson 'grus spel nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang / de ltar 'dod pa la skyo ba bskyed nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos gzhi /
analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus spel nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang / de ltar 'dod pa la skyo ba bskyed nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos gzhi /
translated: The application is from having thus increased one's effort, etc. The actual practice is from having thus generated disgust with desire, etc.

original: skal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa phan yon no //
analyzed: skal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa phan yon no //
translated: The benefits are from the fortunate one, etc.

original: zla ba'i 'od zer kho na dkar ba dang bsil bas tsandan yin te des bsil ba /
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od zer kho na dkar ba dang bsil bas tsandan yin te des bsil ba /
translated: The moon's rays are only white and cool, so it is sandalwood, and it is cool with that.

original: khang bzangs ltar yangs pa rtsub pa ma yin pas nyams dga' ba'i rdo leb la sogs pa skal ba dang ldan pas sgra med pa /
analyzed: khang bzangs ltar yangs pa rtsub pa ma yin pas nyams dga' ba'i rdo leb la sogs pa skal ba dang ldan pas sgra med pa /
translated: The ground is like a palace, not rough, but delightful, with flat stones, etc.

original: 'jam pa nags rlung gis g-yob cing /
analyzed: 'jam pa nags rlung gis g-yob cing /
translated: It is not far from the place where one walks, and is fanned by the gentle forest breezes.

original: thag mi ring ba la 'gro 'ang byed pas 'chag pa /
analyzed: thag mi ring ba la 'gro 'ang byed pas 'chag pa /
translated: It is a place for walking, because one can walk there without difficulty.

original: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa thob pas /üîΩgti mug gi mun par lhung ba'i @248a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa thob pas / gti mug gi mun par lhung ba'i @248a * //

translated: He has no hope for a result of his work,

original: las gzhan don la mtha' gcig tu sred pas so //
analyzed: las gzhan don la mtha' gcig tu sred pas so //

original: nye bar bsdus shing bshad de /
analyzed: nye bar bsdus shing bshad de /
translated: This is the summary and explanation.

original: de bas na rang gzhan la khyad med pas /
analyzed: de bas na rang gzhan la khyad med pas /
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference between self and other,

original: ji ltar gnod pa dang mya ngan dang sogs pa'i sgras grags pa ma yin pa las bdag bsrung ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar gnod pa dang mya ngan dang sogs pa'i sgras grags pa ma yin pa las bdag bsrung ba ltar /
translated: just as he protects himself from harm, sorrow, and so on, and from disrepute,

original: de ltar gzhan dag la yang bsrung ba dang snying rje bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dag la yang bsrung ba dang snying rje bya'o //

original: sems gzung bas bsrung ba'i nus pa med kyang sems bskyed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sems gzung bas bsrung ba'i nus pa med kyang sems bskyed pa'i don du'o //

original: bdag dang gzhan mnyam par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan mnyam par bsgoms nas /

analyzed: bdag dang gzhan brje ba de bas kyang dka' ba dpe'i sgo nas bshad de /

original: bar do las ma'i mngal du 'jug pa na pha dang ma'i sa bon dang khrag gi thig le rim pas nur nur po dang / mer mer po lus po'i bar du thob nas de la bdag tu gzung bas de'i yul bdag med kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa 'byung /
analyzed: bar do las ma'i mngal du 'jug pa na pha dang ma'i sa bon dang khrag gi thig le rim pas nur nur po dang / mer mer po lus po'i bar du thob nas de la bdag tu gzung bas de'i yul bdag med kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa 'byung /
translated: Since one grasps that as a self, the selflessness of that object is grasped as a self.

original: de bzhin gzhan gyi lus po yang bdag tu byas nas ci ste mi bsgom /
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan gyi lus po yang bdag tu byas nas ci ste mi bsgom /
translated: In the same way, why not meditate on the body of another as a self?

original: bsam pa gang dang gang gis ni //
analyzed: bsam pa gang dang gang gis ni //
translated: By whatever thought

original: mi rnams kyi ni yid rnams sbyar //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni yid rnams sbyar //
translated: one directs the mind of a person,

original: de dang de yi ngo bor 'gyur //
analyzed: de dang de yi ngo bor 'gyur //
translated: one will become of that nature,

original: @251b sna tshogs nor bu ji bzhin no //üîΩzhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: @251b sna tshogs nor bu ji bzhin no // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: just like a jewel of various colors.

original: rang gi lus gzhan gyi yin par grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rang gi lus gzhan gyi yin par grub pa kho na ste /
translated: It is established that one‚Äôs own body is that of another.

original: pha ma'i 'brel pa can yin pas bdag gzhan gzhan bdag tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: pha ma'i 'brel pa can yin pas bdag gzhan gzhan bdag tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Since it is related to the parents, one should meditate on the self as the other and on the other as the self.

original: des skyon spang ba dang yon tan blang ba'i dgos pa bshad do //
analyzed: des skyon spang ba dang yon tan blang ba'i dgos pa bshad do //
translated: This explains the purpose of abandoning faults and taking up good qualities.

original: 'o na gzhan la mthar thug med la bdag ni gcig pu yin pas /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan la mthar thug med la bdag ni gcig pu yin pas /
translated: Well, since there is no end to others and one is alone,

original: ji ltar de bdag tu bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de bdag tu bsgom zhe na /
translated: How is it cultivated as the self?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / gcig tu lhag par nges pa'i lus kyi yan lag nyid du /
analyzed: smras pa / gcig tu lhag par nges pa'i lus kyi yan lag nyid du /
translated: It is cultivated as the self by the conviction that the body is the self.

original: ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa du ma yin kyang 'dod pa /
analyzed: ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa du ma yin kyang 'dod pa /
translated: Just as the hand and so on are many, but are accepted as the self of the body,

original: de bzhin du 'gro ba mtha' dag nga'i bdag yin zhes lhag par mos nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro ba mtha' dag nga'i bdag yin zhes lhag par mos nas /
translated: so too, the whole world is my self.

original: de'i yan lag skye bo rnams yin zhes ci ste mi 'dod /üîΩ'o na lag pa la sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: de'i yan lag skye bo rnams yin zhes ci ste mi 'dod / 'o na lag pa la sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: Why not accept that its parts are the people?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin /
translated: But it has been explained that the hand and so on are not the self.

original: slar bskyar ba ci /
analyzed: slar bskyar ba ci /
translated: What is the point of repeating it?

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true,

original: sngar bdag gzhan mnyam pa'i dpe yin gyi 'dir ni bdag gzhan brje ba ste /
analyzed: sngar bdag gzhan mnyam pa'i dpe yin gyi 'dir ni bdag gzhan brje ba ste /
translated: but previously it was an example of the equality of self and other, but here it is the exchange of self and other.

original: don gzhan la brten pas skyon med do //
analyzed: don gzhan la brten pas skyon med do //
translated: Since it is based on a different meaning, there is no fault.

original: gnyis kyis khyad par bshad de /
analyzed: gnyis kyis khyad par bshad de /
translated: The second verse explains the difference:

original: rang gi lus 'di la bdag med kyang goms pas bdag gi blo skye ba ltar gzhan dag la yang bdag gi blo goms pas ci ste mi srid /
analyzed: rang gi lus 'di la bdag med kyang goms pas bdag gi blo skye ba ltar gzhan dag la yang bdag gi blo goms pas ci ste mi srid /
translated: Just as the thought of self arises through familiarity with the selflessness of this body, why is it not possible to generate the thought of self with regard to others through familiarity?

original: srid kyang ci zhe na /
analyzed: srid kyang ci zhe na /
translated: Even if it is possible, so what?

original: smras pa / de ltar bdag tu brtags pas gzhan don byas kyang bdag gis 'di la phan btags zhes rlom sems mi skye /
analyzed: smras pa / de ltar bdag tu brtags pas gzhan don byas kyang bdag gis 'di la phan btags zhes rlom sems mi skye /
translated: Objection: Although one acts for the sake of others by imagining oneself to be a self, one does not give rise to the conceit ‚ÄúI have benefited this person.‚Äù

original: mang ba yin pas ngo mtshar yang mi skye dpe bshad de /
analyzed: mang ba yin pas ngo mtshar yang mi skye dpe bshad de /
translated: Since it is a great deal, one is not even amazed.

original: ji ltar bdag nyid zan za ru bcug nas /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid zan za ru bcug nas /
translated: Just as one feeds oneself,

original: 'jig rten phyi ma la 'bras bu la re ba med pa bzhin /
analyzed: 'jig rten phyi ma la 'bras bu la re ba med pa bzhin /
translated: one hopes for a result in the next world.

original: bdag gzhan brje ba la yang ste /
analyzed: bdag gzhan brje ba la yang ste /
translated: So too, one should exchange oneself for others

original: 'bras bu yang gtang bas so //üîΩde ltar mi nus pa'i skyon spangs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang gtang bas so // de ltar mi nus pa'i skyon spangs te /
translated: and give up one‚Äôs result.

original: log par goms pa la sems sbyar bar bshad de /
analyzed: log par goms pa la sems sbyar bar bshad de /
translated: Thus, one should apply one‚Äôs mind to the avoidance of the fault of being unable to do this.üîΩIt is explained that one should cultivate the thought ‚ÄúI will protect others as I do myself.‚Äù

original: gnod pa dang mya ngan dang sogs pa'i sgras sdug bsngal gzhan las bdag bsrung ba ltar /
analyzed: gnod pa dang mya ngan dang sogs pa'i sgras sdug bsngal gzhan las bdag bsrung ba ltar /
translated: Just as one protects oneself from harm, sorrow, and so on, and by the word ‚Äúand‚Äù one should also include other sufferings,

original: 'gro ba la yang bsrung ba dang snying rje bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba la yang bsrung ba dang snying rje bsgom par bya'o //
translated: so too one should cultivate protection and compassion for sentient beings.üîΩThe example is explained:

original: dpe bshad de de bas na 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs rang gi mtshan nyid spyan ras gzigs zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dpe bshad de de bas na 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs rang gi mtshan nyid spyan ras gzigs zhes bya ba /
translated: Therefore, the noble Avalokitdvara, whose name means ‚Äúhe who looks down with eyes of compassion,‚Äù

original: byin gyis brlabs pa gang zhig snying rlung can yin kyang bdag gi ming brjod pa de'i sdug bsngal dang / tha mar tshogs pa'i nang du spobs pa med pa'i 'jigs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa gang zhig snying rlung can yin kyang bdag gi ming brjod pa de'i sdug bsngal dang / tha mar tshogs pa'i nang du spobs pa med pa'i 'jigs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: If someone who is afflicted with a heart ailment recites my name, I will remove his suffering and, in the end, his fear of being without eloquence in an assembly.

original: dgongs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the thought:

original: bdag bdag ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs zhes gang gis dran pa de kho na bdag yin /
analyzed: bdag bdag ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs zhes gang gis dran pa de kho na bdag yin /
translated: I am not the self, but rather I am the noble Avalokitesvara.

original: @252a * // bdag gis de bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: @252a * // bdag gis de bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: I will protect him.

original: des gsungs pa /
analyzed: des gsungs pa /
translated: He said:

original: gang gis rgud tshe bdag dran na //
analyzed: gang gis rgud tshe bdag dran na //
translated: If, when in trouble, he remembers me,

original: de yi rgud pa bdag gis bzlog //üîΩrang gi thog ma'i smon lam 'di //
analyzed: de yi rgud pa bdag gis bzlog // rang gi thog ma'i smon lam 'di //
translated: I will remove his trouble.

original: bdag la 'ang 'bras bu ldan par mdzod //
analyzed: bdag la 'ang 'bras bu ldan par mdzod //
translated: May I also have the fruit of this, my original vow.

original: ces so // gzhan yang byed pa dka' bar snang ba yang ma goms pas te /
analyzed: ces so // gzhan yang byed pa dka' bar snang ba yang ma goms pas te /
translated: Moreover, what appears to be a difficult action is not so if you are accustomed to it.

original: gang gi phyir goms pas nus pa thob na gang yang byed par dka' ba las mi ldog gang gi phyir lag pa la sogs pa ster ba thos nas sngon du gang skrag par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir goms pas nus pa thob na gang yang byed par dka' ba las mi ldog gang gi phyir lag pa la sogs pa ster ba thos nas sngon du gang skrag par 'gyur /
translated: Because, having heard that one should give one's hands and so on, one is afraid at first.

original: de nyid goms pas da ni de med na mi dgar 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid goms pas da ni de med na mi dgar 'gyur /
translated: But through practice, one now would be unhappy without it.

original: de bas mang po smra mi dgos bdag dang gzhan myur du skyob par 'dod pa gang yin pa des bdag dang gzhan brje ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas mang po smra mi dgos bdag dang gzhan myur du skyob par 'dod pa gang yin pa des bdag dang gzhan brje ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, without further ado, whoever wishes to quickly protect both himself and others should practice the exchange of self and other.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i rigs ma yin pa las gsang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i rigs ma yin pa las gsang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: It is to be kept secret from those who are not of the right spiritual lineage.

original: gzhan du na 'di la ma dad pas ngan song du 'gro ba srid do //üîΩbdag nyid skyon bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa des bdag gzhan gyi skyon dang yon tan bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di la ma dad pas ngan song du 'gro ba srid do // bdag nyid skyon bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa des bdag gzhan gyi skyon dang yon tan bshad de /
translated: Otherwise, it is possible that they will go to the lower realms because of their lack of faith in it.üîΩThe explanation of the faults and virtues of self and other is stated by the verse that begins, Since I have faults...

original: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse that begins, Since I... explains the faults of self and the virtues of other.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa gang las 'jigs pa chung ba grib ma la yi dags su rtogs pa las kyang 'jigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa gang las 'jigs pa chung ba grib ma la yi dags su rtogs pa las kyang 'jigs par 'gyur /
translated: What is more, the fear that arises from the belief in a ghost in the shadow is less than the fear that arises from the belief in a self.

original: sems pa dang ldan pa gang zhig bdag de la khong mi khro /
analyzed: sems pa dang ldan pa gang zhig bdag de la khong mi khro /
translated: What intelligent person would not be angry with such a self?

original: dgra bzhin du 'jigs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dgra bzhin du 'jigs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause of fear, as if it were a demon.

original: bdag 'dzin med na 'jigs pa med de /
analyzed: bdag 'dzin med na 'jigs pa med de /
translated: If there were no belief in a self, there would be no fear,

original: dper na ro bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ro bzhin no //
translated: just as there is no fear of a scarecrow.üîΩWho would want to kill a bird, for example, or to go on a bad road,

original: bkres skom dang nad bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩbya la sogs pa gsod pa dang lam ma yin pa la 'gro ba su de 'dod ces pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bkres skom dang nad bsal bar bya ba'i phyir / bya la sogs pa gsod pa dang lam ma yin pa la 'gro ba su de 'dod ces pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: in order to get rid of hunger and thirst?üîΩWho would want to kill his parents,

original: gang zhig rnyed ba la sogs pa'i don du /
analyzed: gang zhig rnyed ba la sogs pa'i don du /
translated: in order to get wealth, etc.?üîΩIf I live, I will not get wealth. I will steal the wealth of my parents and of the Three Jewels, the Buddha, etc.

original: 'di bdag gson na bdag la rnyed pa mi 'ong bas pha ma yang gsed sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog gsum gyi nor yang 'phrog / sdig pa gang gis mnar med kyi me'i bud shing du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di bdag gson na bdag la rnyed pa mi 'ong bas pha ma yang gsed sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog gsum gyi nor yang 'phrog / sdig pa gang gis mnar med kyi me'i bud shing du 'gyur ro //
translated: I will be the fuel for the fires of Avƒ´ci Hell.

original: blo dang ldan pa gang zhig nyes pa'i 'byung gnas bdag de 'dod //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa gang zhig nyes pa'i 'byung gnas bdag de 'dod //
translated: What intelligent person would want such a self, the source of all misfortune?

original: de la brtse ba byed pa bsrung ba lha ltar mchod //
analyzed: de la brtse ba byed pa bsrung ba lha ltar mchod //
translated: One should protect the beloved as one does a god.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu yin pas dgra bzhin mi lta /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu yin pas dgra bzhin mi lta /
translated: One should not look upon the beloved as an enemy, since he is the cause of all suffering.

original: brnyas pa'i yul la phu dud byed /
analyzed: brnyas pa'i yul la phu dud byed /
translated: One should honor the object of contempt.

original: rang bzhin gyi don la chags pa'i skyon dang yon tan bshad de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi don la chags pa'i skyon dang yon tan bshad de /
translated: The faults and virtues of attachment to one's own aim are explained.

original: gal te slong ba la ster na de'i tshe bdag ci za 'di ltar rang don la chags pa de ser snas sha zar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te slong ba la ster na de'i tshe bdag ci za 'di ltar rang don la chags pa de ser snas sha zar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gives to the petitioner, then at that time one is a cannibal, since one is attached to one's own aim through greed.

original: gal te bdag nyid kyis dran  @252b de'i mchod par bya ba dang rjes su gzung bar bya ba la ci ster zhes gzhan don la 'bad na lha'i dbang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid kyis dran  @252b de'i mchod par bya ba dang rjes su gzung bar bya ba la ci ster zhes gzhan don la 'bad na lha'i dbang por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one strives for the aim of another, thinking, What can I give to the one who is to be honored and protected by the world? then one becomes a lord of gods.

original: rang gi ched du gzhan la gnod pa byas na dmyal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ched du gzhan la gnod pa byas na dmyal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If one harms another for one's own sake, one goes to hell.

original: gzhan don du bdag ngal bar byas na phun sum tshogs pa kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan don du bdag ngal bar byas na phun sum tshogs pa kun 'byung ngo //
translated: If one tires oneself for the sake of another, all perfections arise.

original: bsams pa tsam gyis bdag mtho par 'dod /
analyzed: bsams pa tsam gyis bdag mtho par 'dod /
translated: One desires to be exalted merely by thinking.

original: gang gis ngan song dang / rigs ngan par skye ba dang / glen par 'gyur ba de nyid gzhan la spo bar byas /
analyzed: gang gis ngan song dang / rigs ngan par skye ba dang / glen par 'gyur ba de nyid gzhan la spo bar byas /
translated: One should transfer to others whatever causes rebirth in the lower realms, in a low caste, or as a fool.

original: de mtho bar byas na bde 'gro dang / rim gro dang bcas pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mtho bar byas na bde 'gro dang / rim gro dang bcas pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one elevates others, one will obtain rebirth in the happy realms and will be honored.

original: mtho bar 'dod pa ni rig pa 'am nor ram gzugs la sogs pas nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: mtho bar 'dod pa ni rig pa 'am nor ram gzugs la sogs pas nga rgyal lo //
translated: One who desires to be elevated is proud because of knowledge, wealth, beauty, and so on.

original: rang don du btsan thabs su gzhan bkol na bran la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang don du btsan thabs su gzhan bkol na bran la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one uses force to exploit others for one's own benefit, one will become a slave and so on.

original: rang nyid kyis gzhan don byas na rje dpon dang sogs pa'i sgras skye ba phyi mar rigs mtho ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩnye bar bsdus te bshad 'jig rten du sdug bsngal dang ldan pa ji snyed pa de dag gi bde ba zhen pas so //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis gzhan don byas na rje dpon dang sogs pa'i sgras skye ba phyi mar rigs mtho ba la sogs pa'o // nye bar bsdus te bshad 'jig rten du sdug bsngal dang ldan pa ji snyed pa de dag gi bde ba zhen pas so //
translated: If one acts for the benefit of others, one will become a master and so on. The word and so on indicates that in future lives one will be born in high castes and so on.üîΩThe summary: As many beings as there are in the world who are suffering, one should wish them all happiness.

original: bde ba ldan pa rnams ni gzhan bde bar smon pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba ldan pa rnams ni gzhan bde bar smon pa ste /
translated: As many beings as there are in the world who are happy, one should wish them all to attain enlightenment.

original: sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis dag pa sangs rgyas kyi snying po can yin pas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis dag pa sangs rgyas kyi snying po can yin pas so //
translated: Because beings are naturally pure, they have the essence of the Buddha.

original: dpe bshad de /
analyzed: dpe bshad de /
translated: The example is explained.

original: mang po bshad ci dgos rang don la chags pa so so skye bo dang / gzhan don 'ba' zhig mdzad pa sh'akya thub pa'i khyad par des la bdag gzhan brje pa la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: mang po bshad ci dgos rang don la chags pa so so skye bo dang / gzhan don 'ba' zhig mdzad pa sh'akya thub pa'i khyad par des la bdag gzhan brje pa la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: What need is there to say more? The difference between ordinary people, who are attached to their own interests, and Shakyamuni, who worked solely for the interests of others, is due to the fact that the former did not strive to exchange self and other.

original: gang sangs rgya par mi 'dod cing srid pa'i bde ba la chags pa /
analyzed: gang sangs rgya par mi 'dod cing srid pa'i bde ba la chags pa /
translated: Those who do not wish to become buddhas, who are attached to the pleasures of cyclic existence,

original: des kyang rang gi bde bas gzhan gyi sdug bsngal brje bar ma byas na /
analyzed: des kyang rang gi bde bas gzhan gyi sdug bsngal brje bar ma byas na /
translated: if they do not exchange their own happiness for the suffering of others,

original: de la lha dang mi'i bde ba ga la yod /
analyzed: de la lha dang mi'i bde ba ga la yod /
translated: how can they have the happiness of gods and humans?

original: skye ba phyi ma lta zhog 'jig rten 'dir mthong ba'i don yang mi 'grub kyi /
analyzed: skye ba phyi ma lta zhog 'jig rten 'dir mthong ba'i don yang mi 'grub kyi /
translated: Not to mention future lives, they will not even accomplish their goals in this life.

original: rje dpon gyis gla mi ster na las mis las ma byas na gnyi ga'i don mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rje dpon gyis gla mi ster na las mis las ma byas na gnyi ga'i don mi 'grub po //
translated: If a master does not pay his workers, the workers will not do their work, and the goals of both will not be accomplished.

original: shes bzhin du ma rig pas log pa'i spyod pa bshad de /
analyzed: shes bzhin du ma rig pas log pa'i spyod pa bshad de /
translated: The conduct of those who are aware of this but who are confused is explained.

original: phan tshun du bde ba skyed pa bor nas de ji lta bu 'jig rten 'di dang / phyi mar bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu de bzhag nas dmyal ba'i rgyu phan tshun du gnod pa byas nas /
analyzed: phan tshun du bde ba skyed pa bor nas de ji lta bu 'jig rten 'di dang / phyi mar bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu de bzhag nas dmyal ba'i rgyu phan tshun du gnod pa byas nas /
translated: Having abandoned the cause of mutual happiness in this world and the next, why do they take up suffering by harming each other?

original: sdug bsngal len te rmongs pas so //üîΩphyi dang nang du gnod pa ni srid pa dang / sdug bsngal dang 'jigs pa ni srid pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal len te rmongs pas so // phyi dang nang du gnod pa ni srid pa dang / sdug bsngal dang 'jigs pa ni srid pa /

original: de thams cad bdag tu 'dzin pa las byung ba //
analyzed: de thams cad bdag tu 'dzin pa las byung ba //
translated: All inner and outer harm, all suffering, fear, and anxiety arise from self-grasping.

original: de bas bdag tu 'dzin pas ci //
analyzed: de bas bdag tu 'dzin pas ci //

original: @253a * // dper na rang gi lag gis dug za bas so //
analyzed: @253a * // dper na rang gi lag gis dug za bas so //

analyzed: 'o na bdag tu 'dzin pa 'di sems can kun phyug dang bya la yang yod de /

original: mda' dang rdob 'phen pa mthong nas 'bros pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mda' dang rdob 'phen pa mthong nas 'bros pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bdag 'dzin shes pa yin pas de'i shes bya bdag kho na'o //

analyzed: 'di la brjod pa shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: rtog bcas dang rtog med do //
analyzed: rtog bcas dang rtog med do //

analyzed: de la rtog med ni shes bya la dmigs nas skye ba'i phyir de med na mi 'byung ngo //

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa ni rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa ni rtog pa yin te /

original: yul med kyang 'byung /
analyzed: yul med kyang 'byung /

analyzed: gzhan du na bdag rgyal po yin zhes brtags pas rgyal por 'gyur ro //

original: de bas ; bdag tu 'dzin pa ma spangs na //
analyzed: de bas ; bdag tu 'dzin pa ma spangs na //
translated: Therefore, as long as the grasping of self is not abandoned,

original: sdug bsngal spong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal spong bar mi nus so //

original: dper na me ma spangs na de'i drod spong mi nus so //
analyzed: dper na me ma spangs na de'i drod spong mi nus so //

original: nye bar bsdus shing bshad de /
analyzed: nye bar bsdus shing bshad de /

analyzed: de bas rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: sems can thams cad la bdag gis lus bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten 'bul lo //

original: des bdag 'dzin bzlog / bsod nams kyi tshogs 'byung /
analyzed: des bdag 'dzin bzlog / bsod nams kyi tshogs 'byung /

analyzed: dus thog ma med pa nas sems can la gnod pa byas pa'i sdig pa'ang zad do //

original: gzhan dag bdag bzhin du gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag bdag bzhin du gzung bar bya'o //

original: lus phul gnas rang gi sems la gces pa'i bu bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: lus phul gnas rang gi sems la gces pa'i bu bzhin du bslab par bya'o //

analyzed: kye yid gzhan la gzhan la la phul bdag gzhan gyi yin zhes mnyes par gyis shig / de bas de ring nas brtsams te /

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don kho na khyod kyis bsam par bya'i /

original: gzhan ma yin te /üîΩbdag la chags pas mi dge ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin te / bdag la chags pas mi dge ba ma yin no //
translated: and not of your own welfare.üîΩYou must not be attached to your own welfare,

original: rang dga' ba'i phyir ci 'ang blta bar mi bya ste ;
analyzed: rang dga' ba'i phyir ci 'ang blta bar mi bya ste ;
translated: and you must not look for pleasure.

original: gang gi phyir yid du 'ong ba'i yul la rjes su chags pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba la khong khro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid du 'ong ba'i yul la rjes su chags pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba la khong khro bar 'gyur ro //

original: sus mi lta zhe na /
analyzed: sus mi lta zhe na /

original: de dag gi ste de dag la byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ste de dag la byin pa'i phyir ro //

original: sogs pa'i sgras rna ba la sogs pas sgra la sogs so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras rna ba la sogs pas sgra la sogs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the ears and so on, and sounds and so on.

original: rang gi don du lag pa la sogs pa'i g-yo ba yang mi rigs te ;
analyzed: rang gi don du lag pa la sogs pa'i g-yo ba yang mi rigs te ;
translated: It is not right to move your hands and so on for your own sake.

original: gang la srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa log par g-yem pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa log par g-yem pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa des na gzhan gyi don du nye bar 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa des na gzhan gyi don du nye bar 'gyur ba la /

original: rang gi lus las gang gang mthong ba de dang de blangs shing gzhan dag la byin /
analyzed: rang gi lus las gang gang mthong ba de dang de blangs shing gzhan dag la byin /
translated: Whatever they see on their own bodies, they take that and give it to others.

original: des dngos po la sred pa dang @253b rlom sems med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des dngos po la sred pa dang @253b rlom sems med par 'gyur ro //

original: snying rje gzhan don lta ci smos /
analyzed: snying rje gzhan don lta ci smos /

original: de ltar goms pas skyon thams cad zad pa dang / yon tan thams cad 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar goms pas skyon thams cad zad pa dang / yon tan thams cad 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By becoming accustomed to that, all faults are exhausted and all good qualities increase.

original: de phyir 'gro ba'i gnyen gyi ni //
analyzed: de phyir 'gro ba'i gnyen gyi ni //
translated: Therefore, for the friends of the world,

original: thabs dang snying rje mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: thabs dang snying rje mchog tu 'gyur //

original: zhes gsungs so //üîΩda ni dman pa'i sems can la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // da ni dman pa'i sems can la sogs pa la /

original: rlom sems la sogs pa'i rnyog ma spang ba'i phyir bshad de /
analyzed: rlom sems la sogs pa'i rnyog ma spang ba'i phyir bshad de /
translated: Now, in order to eliminate the turbidity of conceit and so on with regard to inferior sentient beings and so on, it is explained.

analyzed: dman pa la rlom sems dang / mnyam pa la 'gran pa dang / mchog la phrag dog byis pa rnams la skye ste /

original: rlom sems la sogs pa de nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin kyang /
analyzed: rlom sems la sogs pa de nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin kyang /

analyzed: gzhan dang bdag brje ba rnam par byang ba'i rgyur 'gro ste /

analyzed: de bas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas / rnam rtog med pa ni the tshom med pas so //
translated: Therefore, through the reasoning to be explained,üîΩone should meditate on the absence of conceptualization, i.e., the absence of doubt.

analyzed: the tshom med pa sgoms shig / phrag dog la sogs pa kho na bsgom par bshad de /

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is explained in the lines beginning with ‚ÄúThis . . .‚Äù

analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pas bdag mchog tu gyur pa dang / gzhan de dang bral bas dman par mthong na rang la phrag dog bsgoms te /

analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya bas bdag gzhan du gyur par bstan to //

analyzed: bdag ces bya bas gzhan bdag tu gyur pa bstan to //

original: de ltar 'chad par 'gyur ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar 'chad par 'gyur ba la yang ngo //

original: las ni khur khur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las ni khur khur ba la sogs pa'o //

original: sems khral med pas legs par gnas /
analyzed: sems khral med pas legs par gnas /

original: che ba ni goms pa dang 'bad pas bsgrubs te /
analyzed: che ba ni goms pa dang 'bad pas bsgrubs te /

original: bdag la 'ang srid /
analyzed: bdag la 'ang srid /

analyzed: gong ma la ltos nas khyed kyang dman no //

analyzed: bdag pas kyang dman pa yod de /

analyzed: gang la bdag mchog yin no zhes phrag dog dang bcas pa'o// tshul la sogs pa khyod la med can /

analyzed: 'di thams cad nyon mongs pa'i mthus 'byung gi / bdag gi 'dod pas ma yin /

analyzed: 'on te mi 'grib pa'i rigs pas gso bar bya ba ma yin /

analyzed: bdag mtho 'di dman byas te ci'i phyir bdag la brnyas pa byed /

analyzed: smras pa / de'i yon tan gyis bdag la ci /

original: rang gi don du kho yon tan can yin pas so //
analyzed: rang gi don du kho yon tan can yin pas so //

analyzed: snying rje gzhan don yin te de kho la med par bshad de /

analyzed: de'i kha la gnas pa'i skye bo la 'di snying rje med pas so //

analyzed: gzhan yang yon tan la sogs pas bdag mnyam par shes nas /

analyzed: yon tan 'phel ba la 'bad par gyis /

original: dge ba'i mchog sba bar shugs kyis bstan te /
analyzed: dge ba'i mchog sba bar shugs kyis bstan te /
translated: The supreme virtue of hiding one‚Äôs good qualities is taught implicitly:

analyzed: bdag gis de ltar brtsam par bya'i ji ltar 'jig rten kun la bdag gi yon tan gsal bar 'gyur ;

analyzed: gzhan yang 'di'i yon tan gzhan sus kyang mi thob pa'o //

analyzed: deng bdag gis rnyed pa legs par rnyed cing /

analyzed: goms pas shin tu spro ba bshad de / shin tu dga' ba'i sems kyis yun ring po zhig nas 'di la ma rung ba byas pa rnyed pa la sogs pa las phyir phyung ba /
translated: The author explains the great delight that comes from being accustomed to this attitude:üîΩFor a long time, with a mind of great joy, I have been looking for an opportunity to harm him,

analyzed: skyon brjod pas skye bo rnams kyis bzhad gad byas pa /

original: dman pa la rlom sems bshad de /
analyzed: dman pa la rlom sems bshad de /

analyzed: bstan bcos la sogs pa'i thos pa de tsam kho la yod dam /

analyzed: bdag la yod pa bzhin shes rab dang / gzugs dang / rigs dang nor te de med do //

analyzed: de ltar bdag gi yon @254b tan phyogs kun tu skye bo rnams kyis bsgrags pa thos nas /

analyzed: spu ldang zhing dga' ba dga' ston la longs spyad par bya'o //

analyzed: gal te 'di la rnyed pa 'ga' zhig yod na bdag gis btsan thabs su phrogs te thams cad ma yin /

original: 'on kyang 'di la 'tsho ba tsam byin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di la 'tsho ba tsam byin te /
translated: But I will give it just enough to live on,

original: bdag gi bya ba byed pas so //
analyzed: bdag gi bya ba byed pas so //
translated: because it is doing my work.

original: der ma zad 'di bde ba las kyang nyams par byas la /
analyzed: der ma zad 'di bde ba las kyang nyams par byas la /

original: bdag gis sdug bsngal la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sdug bsngal la sbyar bar bya'o //

original: bdag gis sdug bsngal gyi khur po 'di'i mgo la gzhag gi gang gi sngon du 'khor gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rdeg pa la sogs pas bag med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bar byas so //

original: da ni drang por yid la go ba bskyed cing bshad de /
analyzed: da ni drang por yid la go ba bskyed cing bshad de /
